review: My family and I used to come here at least once a month, and the last three times we went were terrible. Just today, we were waiting to be seated for over 10 minutes... no hostess at the front, and two waitresses walked pass us. We had a 3 year old boy who was pretty hungry, so our patience was wearing thin. Then, another customer walks in, and gets INSTANTLY greeted by the manager. I tell her we've been waiting for 10 minutes, and she's going to greet and seat someone who just walked in???? Wow.  This location has lost us as customers for life. Maybe get new management who actually knows what they're doing and has had some basic customer service training!
Their service is way too slow.  Takes forever to get seated and get your food.  Not coming back again.

Worst service! Food took forever to come out..... never got our appetizer until I asked someone to get our server and we already had our food. Didn't have silverware, she forgot our waters. The salad didn't come with dressing. This was the worst experience with chilis ever had. We asked another server around us twice for help since ours was no where to be found.

This barely made it to 3 stars for me. Only reason why I added a Star was because the service was pretty good. The food itself was more like a 2, hence I won't really ever come back. I think I've been to another chain before, but I don't remember the food being this bleh. I opted for a lighter lunch and got the anchor salmon. Comes with rice and string beans. The salmon was a little too overcooked for me. The rice was okay and the string beans were so old and tough. I had to spit some out because I couldn't even swallow it! We also ordered the chicken fajitas. That was also not so good. The chicken had a weird bounciness to them, almost seemed like the middle wasn't cooked. It came with some wraps, salsa and sour cream and onions. We ordered the fried cheese as appetizers and that was probably the best dish we had and even so, that was just decent. Was really disappointed and I hate eating bad food because I feel like it wastes stomach space and I leave very unhappy lol.

This is the best place by far, the customer service is top notch. The manager is super awesome and her name is fariba. And our server Mel is uber cool, we had a great time and we will come here as long as we crave for chilis.

Waited about 15 min to get seated.  No one was at the front desk and staff was walking pass.  hey people in front of me had to stop some some one with their hands full to get them seated.  Then the staff seated us.   Table wasnt set and the floor was slippery like some one spilled oil on the ground. Orrdered a 2 for $22 deal.  Got a 6 oz Sirloin steak and mango tilapia.  The steak for okay,  The tilipia wasnt good  well and it was kind of bland.  The potatoes seemed like there was too much butter and sour cream.  Service wasnt so bad as the Capatola Chilis but could use some improvements like giving us napkins with our meals.   Overall the experience was alright but probably not going to come to this chilis

It's the first time I am here. The staff are super nice and professional. Although they are very busy but it's clear that they are going above and beyond to create a great dining environment for the guests. Special thanks to Ms. Mel for her hospitality. The food is awesome, no question about that. It was a pleasant dinner time on Saturday night and I'm really glad we have such a good restaurant in out town. Thanks to you all!

Visited the bar for a quick burger and beer.   Ordered the grass fed burger.   My burger was grossly overcooked... to the point where it was not enjoyable to eat. Service in the bar was poor.  No personality, no skills, no consideration for the charcoal burger. I used to enjoy a burger or ribs indulgence at Chilis.   Now, I am rethinking keeping Chili's on my go-to list, especially for hambugers.  When Carls grass fed is better then Chilis, they got a problem.

I had come here last week for a business lunch and my food was satisfactory.  I had not come here for a long time so thought maybe the place has turned the corner and may be decent. Took my family in and it was a big mistake.  We usually get beef nacho's for an appetizer and first of all, it took about 45 min just to get this appetizer out.  Then I noticed the meat was not the regular meat they use for this dish.  Instead if looked and tasted like meat strips instead of the regular beef. One of our burgers was overcooked and inedible.   Showed the manager and she just shrugged it off.  I'm not one of those people who complain about the food so they take it off the bill.   If food is bad I'll just pay for it so i can get the hell out of the place and probably never come back again.

When I went here on a different night, service seemed great, it was very professional and the manager even came up twice to see how we were doing.  Seems that they have a better team on days other than Thursday nights.  Last night (Thursday), our waitress was fine, but the other service seemed a little weird. My date and I walked in around 7:40pm, and it wasn't as crowded as usual and we were the only people waiting for a little bit.  They only had one half of the restaurant tables open.  It seemed like the staff were struggling because there weren't very many of them.  We waited about 7 minutes for a staff to appear to see that we were in the front.  She asked us which of the 2 groups were there first.  My date and I raised our hands, and she like ignored it and kept asking us which one was first.  We kept saying "us" and I guess she finally believed us. She said some stuff really fast which I didn't catch (probably that they needed to clear some tables first and then they'd seat us). We sat and waited to get a table.  Even though the place had mostly families, the crowd that night seemed to be kind of rowdy/ shady.  There were a bunch of people there just to eat at the bar thing.  As usual, it was crazy loud in there.  The staff came back to seat us.    The waitress came back almost right away and asked for our drink orders (waters) and we had to ask to get chips, about 15 minutes after when she came back.  We got our food in an average amount of time.  The food was good (I got a smothered burrito which was the size of a newborn baby), though some of the cheese in my burrito was not melted and it was kind dry on the insde.  We got a pizookie for dessert; the cookie itself was as dry as the desert (not dessert), but the ice cream on top made at least the middle edible.  When we were done, the waitress came by and asked if I need a box, and instantly handed me one, which was impressive. When I went to use the restroom, there was a horrible poo smell, coming from I'm guessing the men's bathroom.  When I came back out to go to my table, I overhead a female staff in the kitchen by the bathrooms say hecka loud "...took a sh*t!"  Um, that's nice.  I don't know about you, but I'd rather not hear people that are involved with preparing my food even mentioning poop, haha.  I thought it was kind of unprofessional.   Basically, the food was good to alright, but the service last night seemed subpar.
Table side Guacamole with the chips and salsa is always a must! Bar is noisy but service was quick!

One server Sheenal who was great, the one short grey black haired lady did not help her but chi chat ...  won't be coming back anytime soon the bar tender refused to take our order said to tell the waitress real Team Work going on here

Well, this was just awful... We've been coming to this branch of Chili's regularly for most of the 20 years that we've lived nearby.  Food can vary anywhere from merely *good*, to really fantastic.  Service was always superb; our server would walk by every few minutes to see if we wanted anything; we used to have a joke about Chili's: "Well, I guess we aren't going to save on tips today!!". However, we haven't been in over a year... and in that time, things have really changed... Food was okay; my Ultimate Burger was excellent; milady's fajitas were so-so; even though they charged us $2 extra for beef, the fajitas were mostly green peppers and onion. However, service was appalling !!!  When we first were seated, we waited so long without being acknowledged in *any way*, that I finally grabbed some employee who was walking by, and asked "does anyone even know we are here??  Nobody has spoken to us at all!!" (except for the person who seated us)... this was after several minutes, at a time when most of their tables were empty (Friday evening, about 4:30PM). However, it just went downhill from there.  The "server" who was assigned to us, almost never came by... when I wanted a refill on beer, I walked up to the bar and ordered it myself.  When I wanted a refill on dressing for my fries, I had to walk up to the workers area and ask for it myself.  The server only came by twice; once just after I walked up to the bar myself, to see if I'd gotten what I wanted, and a second time to deliver our bill.  Just awful. It will be a *long* time before we enter this building again...

Okay....time for an update!  Today, me and my honey got the 2 for $22 and are very happy!  Steak was perfectly cooked and Chanelle, our server, was very pleasant and made our experience one that will make us return!  Zen even stopped by to say hi!   Happy new year!

I'm B-OK with "Chili's" and I jotted B-OK instead of A-OK deliberately, because I wouldn't want anybody to think I've mistaken this for A-quality food. For instance, I had the baby back ribs, and they're good, but they're not Texas roadhouse good. I mean, let's be blunt here. They're less than bountiful and the sauce is less than luscious. And I hate saying all this because I know tomorrow I'm going to get a message from "Chili's" PR apologizing that my "experience" wasn't up to par, yada yada yada, and give me a smarmy plea to give us another chance, yada yada yada, and it's probably somebody in PR that's never had Louisiana or Texas BBQ, never had anything but they're own food. Because this is what happens when you review a well-known chain and say anything that's not 100% flattering. But if you've followed me long enough on Yelp, you know me by now, and know that I review everything whether it was asking for my opinion or not. And so despite my better judgment, I press on. Yes, "Chili's" is reliably good if you like second-tier BBQ. I will probably be going back more throughout the years because I'll be raising a family. Did you hear that PR?? (Double-question mark.) I said, I will be back here more throughout the years, whenever I'm ready to gobble B-OK food at reasonable prices that's gentle on my pocketbook. I like the spaciousness of "Chili's." I like the fact that it's good for kids for that fact, and gives them a steakhouse type of ambiance with lots to look at, and an amiable staff of waiters good at entertaining kids off the cuff. For myself, I like the Sports TV's. I'm sure kids like the kiosks which gives you the option to order food if the waiter is not there immediately. I also, by the way, had bites of Southwestern egg rolls, chipotle chicken strips and Santa Fe Chicken Wrap in case you were worried I hadn't sampled enough here. Anyway, bottom line, I'm not a lover here but I like "Chili's."  #borderline

been here a few times and always pretty good. finally tried the 2 for 35 menu with drinks and was very pleased with the mango chicken! also the Texas cheese fries were delicious! our server was a girl whom i never seen before. her name was nasi. she was great! very quick service and nice person. seemed to really care about her job and enthusiastic to be there. nice to see. great job girl! we have also had the gentleman waiter a few times and he is great as well. will update when i have his name, but it's been during the week when we have had him. also like how they serve the presidente margarita . also, the lava cake is 100 times better than the frozen one i had at olive garden! only reason for not 5 stores is my margarita could of had a tad more tequila

So, let me just start by saying, I come here often. I love the rewards system, just a few simple points and I'll get some free chips, a kids meal for the kids or even a dinner for two!  However, last Sunday, I truly felt so disappointed in not only the service but the food quality as well.  There was only 2 of us in our party, I'm not too sure how you could fall short as a server for a party of 2, but it definitely happened.  Asked for ranch, forgot the ranch. Asked for additional chips, never got. The best part, my fajitas were full of only onions, 1 small slice of a bell pepper and 3 strips of chicken.  Did I complain? Nope! I just ate and made the best of the situation.  However, here's where it gets rough.  Our server dropped our food off and not once came by to ask us how our meal was, nor refill our 'WATER' and generally I base service off of refills.  I can't get upset with a server for food, it's not the servers fault if the food isn't the best, but for refills and checking on customers - that's definitely the servers job.  So, when I looked around, saw that my server had stopped by her other '2' tables multiple times, I was pretty upset. I thought about grabbing the jug of water to refill my drink, but thought... 'Nah! Not worth it!'  After we finished our meals, dying of thirst, she came by and said 'here's your bill, please let me know if you need anything else!'  My reply 'How about some water and a kiosk to input my # for rewards' with a sigh, she said 'Were short on them!'  So, needless to say, no rewards for my meal and definitely no service!'  Good thing there's many Chili's in our area! This one, I probably will have to avoid!

Wow!!!! All i have to say is this place went down hill.let me start with waited 1hour for my take out order. Get food home missing rice and beans on all four orders. Food is ice cold. Also word to manager you have employee walking around with a coffee in her hand drinking it in the kitchen area.you need team players not children in your kitchen!! Oh also why do 3 employees have to open your take out food to place condiments not to   wonder everyone's food is ice COLD!!!!
Very very bad service. Special bar tandor.. before coming plz think. I am not recomend chills. Bad service

My server at Chillis was awesome; he was professional, courteous and very timely with my drink refills. The Manager for this location was not professional, in fact, I beleive she profiled me because of race and treated me indifferent compared to the other customers. When me and my husband walked in and our hostesses seated us, the manager said 'hello' to us as we walked to our table. There was a group of 3-4 that were finishing up that sat behind us; they used the table device to pay and left. We ordered our food, ate and discussed how we were going to tip our waiter (via cash or on our credit card). As we discussed the tip I noticed that the manager was awkwardly lingering by our table. As I took out my credit card she stared at me, then she moved right in front of my table and stood there ... watching me. It made me so uncomfortable, I didn't understand what was going on so I asked her if there was a problem. She explained that there was something wrong with the table devices and their internet connection so she was waiting to see if our device worked. If what she said was true why wouldn't she just take the devices off the table until the issue was resolved? Or have the waiters and waitresses process all payments until the issue was resolved? I told her if the device didn't work I would just pay though the waiter, I also had cash on me that I could use if all else failed. As I initially swiped my card through the table device the manager tried to grab my card so she could swipe it; I have to pull my hand away and tell her 'give me a chance to swipe my card'. She said 'okay' but still stood right next to me watching me swipe my card, select my tip amount, sign my name and enter my email address for the receipt. Honestly, I initially thought she was trying to steal my credit card information, as she stood so close to me, making sure she could see the screen of the table device and attempted to take my card out my hand. Then I realized she thought I wasn't going to pay, so she stood there watching me to ensure I paid before I left. After I paid the device turned green and she immediately picked it up off the table device as if she was looking at it, when I walked outside I saw through the windows she quickly put it back down on the table.

On Saturday I had lunch here with my family and parents. Everyone booed and threw rocks at me when I walked in, and so I felt right at home. (Getting a pitcher of water dumped on my head was a bonus.) A woman and her daughter cut in front of us, but it didn't really matter. They were seated first because it was just the two of them. The hostess was pretty and professional. I was annoyed, however, when she asked me about whether or not we could fit in a booth. The booths here can barely seat 4. The 5 of us would have been packed like sardines in one. I strongly indicated that we needed to be seated at a table (for 6). Wardrobe Malfunction: The woman and her daughter were sitting near us. At one point, the woman's boobs fell out (they just needed some air). Sadly, though, I couldn't get my binoculars up in time. o_O The men's restroom is a little small, and it smelled like bleach when I went in. On the plus side, the restroom was clean. The tables weren't bussed as quickly as they should have been. We could have been seated at this one long table, but it wasn't cleared off for a number of minutes.  Our server was friendly, but kind of slow. I'm not docking for this, but she wasn't available when we really needed her (a group of about 8 took forever to order- some of the people were looking around like they didn't know what a menu was). My dad called the hostess over. To her credit, she filled in for our server and was very quick. (My mom was nice. Our server didn't deserve it, but she received a $15 tip.) A tall busboy made me laugh. He had a goofy look on his face and was basically dressed like a Chippendales dancer. The tables are too close to each other. I felt uncomfortable when a family was suddenly seated at the table behind me. (The area on the left is somewhat spacious, but it wasn't being used. People were encouraged to eat at the bar if they wanted to be seated right away.) Space is an issue in terms of the waiting area too. There are a good number of TV's inside (my dad was watching the Washington-UCLA game). We had to wait about 20 minutes for our food (it was busy here). Our bill was for over $90. Crispy Cheddar Bites: 8/10. "White and yellow Wisconsin cheese curds topped with chile spices, cilantro. Served with ancho-chile ranch." No one had any of the ancho-chile ranch. Anyway, I forgot from ordering them in the past that the Crispy Cheddar Bites would be salty (my wife thinks that the food at Chili's is salty in general). Still, they were good, and even my dad had some (he normally stays away from cheese). You receive about 25 Crispy Cheddar Bites, making this item easy to share. Pepper Pal Meals (for kids 12 and under): All the meals are $5.20 or $5.50. The portions are solid, and you can add a 2nd side for only $1. Chicken Dippers ($5.50): 8/10. My son liked his chocolate milk, and he was given a refill. He also liked the Homestyle Fries. The Chicken Dippers are made with all-natural chicken. I had one, and it was softer and tastier than I expected. House BBQ Half Order Ribs ($11.69): 7.5/10. My ribs were meaty and delicious, but I only received 3 (my wife was surprised, and my mom felt so sorry for me that she gave me a lot of her food). My Homestyle Fries were pretty good, but they could have been hotter. I also could have received a bigger portion. The BBQ sauce is just right (it's not too light or too strong in taste). Caribbean Salad with Grilled Chicken: 8/10. "Pineapple, mandarin oranges, dried cranberries, red bell peppers, green onions, cilantro, sesame seeds with honey-lime dressing." My wife enjoyed her meal. She just could have been given some more pineapple. The piece of chicken that I had was succulent. It was also so fresh that I had to slap it. "Oh, behave!" Mix & Match Trio: 8/10. My mom received a fair amount of food. She was easily able to make 3 fajitas for me. The steak and chicken were cooked nicely. They were also flavorful. The flour tortillas were strong and medium-sized. The shredded cheese was thick and solid in taste. The Mexican rice was spicy (this was a surprise, but not a bad one), but just average tasting. The pieces of shrimp were pretty small, but my mom and wife liked them (I don't know what he ordered, but my dad's meal featured some shrimp too). My mom didn't eat all of her onions, and she forgot to say that she didn't want any bell peppers (they no longer go well with her stomach). We had a nice time, and the staff worked well together. I wasn't happy about everything, but I recommend eating here overall.

We had a late lunch here on a Saturday. The place was about half full and we were seated right away. We ordered the following. 1. Full rack of ribs. Half with dry rub and half with house bbq sauce. The latter was better. The dry rub was a bit dry but it was still good. It comes with a whole corn that was a bit mushy. The fries was just okay. 2. Cajun pasta. This was an alfredo based sauce with strips of chicken breasts. The chicken was tasty, moist and has a bit of a kick from black peppers. The pasta was nicely cooked al dente. The sauce was not as thick as I would like. It was still good because we managed to finish the entire thing. It comes with garlic bread.  The service was good. Our food came out fast. Our server kept checking on us and was very good with our soda refills.

I have not stepped foot into a Chili in years. My last experience here was pretty bad. My food was cold and dry, and portion was small. I recently came here with my boyfriend and friends, and I was surprised how much this Chili have changed. The ambiance was nice and clean. The new look is good. I got their dinner for 2, and shared with my boyfriend. You get to choose 1 appetizer and 2 entrees. We got their fresh quacamole with salsa on the side. Their chips are served warm, very light, and crispy. Their chips are unlimited, so don't be afraid to ask for refills. I know we did. So worth!  I got their original chicken crispers and my boyfriend got their crispy honey chipotle chicken crispers. When the server came with my food, DAMN! My crispers were huge. The meal came with a corn on the cob and a side of fries, and five pieces of chicken. The crisper was fried perfectly. I thought it was all batter, nope! All MEAT! Yumm! Never thought I would rate this place a 5 star. Service was good too. Our server made sure we had water and refilled our chips.  Overall, I'm surprised about my experience here. Food and service was good, can't complain. No doubt I'll be coming back, and their deals are pretty good too compared to their competitors. They have a lot more varieties to choose from.

A great place for a quick bite but the food quality isn't that good. I got bacon and chicken quesadillas which were ok. They had too much cheese and too little bacon. Though it is a great place for a local family dinner.

I have been dining at Chili's with my family for as long as I can remember. This place, having been here for half my life, brings me that warm & fuzzy feeling sometimes as it reminds me of those years of dining here just before we go off to the Haunted House attraction right next door when halloween season comes around.  What's great about this place is that year after year it stays consistent.  I've never had any issues with my food, never had a complaint about the service and I hope I never do.  They have the perfect location right at the center of Fremont in the Fremont Hub (which, I know literally means 'at the center').  You can't not order the molten lava cake when you come here. Even if you feel like you can't take another bite. The Molten Lava cake is a must. Oh, and I don't know how long the Honey Chipotle Chicken crisper has been on the menu but anytime you put chicken & waffles together I'm all over it!  Then, once you've dine, stroll over to Target or Marshalls to walk off all those calories. They're also located in the hub. And, if I really want to torture myself - I'll walk to Pier1 where I literally want everything they've got.

Crappiest service last night.  Our waitress took our order and never showed up.   I had to ask some other person where our food was.  Didnt get food until 30 min.  WTF!  We had two kids, 7 and 3.  They ordered from kids menu. Usually we get the kids stuff right away, not that night   Such crappy service.

Recently service has taken a step in a positive direction.  We stopped in during dinner hour and initially waited a while for our server but after that it was smooth sailing. The waitress was attentive, really sweet and other servers often checked in on our table as well.  We ordered the 2 for 22 which comes with 1 appetizer and 2 full size entrees from the select menu, very good deal. I highly recommend the chicken fajitas! The chicken was well seasoned and cooked and the toppings are on point! They also have a lot of TV's in the main dining area which make it possible to watch the game from anywhere you sit.  Overall a really pleasant experience for a weeknight dinner.

As a frequent visitor here I always get a so so experience, but on this Sunday afternoon it was just perfect!  We sat in the bar area since it wasn't busy and ordered some happy hour appetizers. Queso and buffalo wings, yummy!  For our entree I ordered the potato soup and side salad  with blue cheese dressing, salad was fresh and soup was nice and creamy!  My boyfriend ordered the Honey Chipotle shrimp and sirloin, no complaints there except the sirloin was a little on the smaller side and to be honest it was almost picture perfect!  Our server Andrea was very attentive and frequently filled our drinks and asked if we needed anything. Also very clean atmosphere!  Overall great experience!
Fast bar service! Andrea and Rich are awesome!  Fast bar service! Andrea and Rich are awesome!

4 stars for what Chili's is - not comparing it to any Michelin!  I am grateful for Chilis. Easy, simply, and salty (cue salt bae). Really though - you have to ask for no added salt to some of their dishes. Sometimes service can be slow and sometimes service can be on point. You'll never know what you'll get! We came in when the dubs were playing the kings. Chilis has plenty of TVs, so no matter where you're sitting, you can see some game action. The bar can be packed if there is a game on though, but I like my comfy seats away from people #personalbubble There was a loud and large table next to us; we didn't mind because.. well, Chili's. And it's nice to be nice. On the other hand, the servers weren't too happy with the large table (on a slow Wednesday..). Well none of my business. Chili's is my rock - nothing will change and that's the way I like it. But change your tequila : margarita mix ratio because it hydrates me unfortunately. :x

Sat at the bar, since it's happy hour all day Sunday.. surprisingly, it was super busy. Since, there was a Halloween event really close by. We ordered margaritas and a Bloody Mary for drinks. The food wise chili cheese fries and veggie rolls. It, was ok but can't complain about happy hour. Surprisingly, at the bar only one waitress. So give her props for doing it by herself. Only 4 stars cuz the food/drinks was just ok. Plus the restrooms look gross.

Still like this place because we go way back but after eating the chicken n waffles there i got so sick i had to miss work the next day. I recommend the chili, the chips and salsa although the chips are clearly unauthentically extra thin. The dinner deals are always cheap, beers are tall and the vibes are very Tex-Mex American Infusion.

I'm writing this because I want to give credit where it's due and it's due here... we ate in the bar and my husband had a "Sunrise burger" he loved it! pepper jack cheese, bl&t and a chili's signature sauce that was perfectly cooked! The gentleman who helped us was probably the bar manager, if he's not he should be, I don't remember his name (my bad) all 3 stars are for him!! he ran that bar area like it was his home he welcomed everybody! a homeless man came in and was treated with dignity was welcomed and ate at the bar, it was heartwarming to see the way the gentleman/manager treated him and for that I will be returning to this chili's and hope you will also!!

This place is disgusting and they are super cheap with their resources. Avoid!! The Bacon Ranch Chicken Quesadilla barely had any Bacon or chicken. It was about 90% cheese, nothing like the pic, and it costs about $11. Taco bell puts this place to shame with the ingredients they provide.

To be Honest, I am not a fan of Chili's. I was shopping at target and my sister spotted chili's and wanted to give it a try. I tried to stop her but you know how baby sisters are? So, we went for lunch and ordered the following - Food Panko Onion Rings (4/5) - I loved them, they were hot, crunchy and paired well with ranch.  Service Very slow, Not happy !! We had to wait for 20 minutes for water  Ambiance Nothing special, just like any other chili's Overall, enjoyed the onion rings but the slow service was a bummer. Also, the glasses in which the water was served were not clean.

I was extremely satisfied with how great of a service we were given by our server, her name was Emily. Please cherish this girl! She is an extreme asset to this establishment.  Their chips and salsa are my favorite, super thin and not too salty! I tried their (what I would consider new since I haven't been here in a while) buffalo cauliflower! It was amazing! I'm slowing converting over to a vegetarian and this plate alone convinced me that I can do this.. I also have always been a fan of their chicken enchilada soup!  They've really upgraded their menu options and brought in a few new things which is a great change for them.  It's really hard for me to go out to eat sometimes with having a 2 almost 3 year old being very picky on who she interacts with and what she wants to eat. As soon as my daughter met Emily it was like she was her best friend. My step daughter really enjoyed her as a person as well. She even brought them ice cream :) Emily constantly checked back with us and reassured us if anything she'd be right here for anything we could need. It's rare to find a server whom is so punctual and attentive, as herself. I'd definitely come back and hopefully get to experience just as great service here again. Thank you again Emily, my family adored you. You're so kind and seemed like a genuinely nice person.. You'll be a great asset to wherever you end up in your future.

I had a excellent experience here, but when do I have a bad experience at chilis.... never.  we instantly got greeted and sat. It was really nice. The host was super sweet and our drink orders were taken fast.  I wish I could remember our servers name because she was ON TOP of things! She was nice, fast, didn't snark when we asked for extra sauces and she overall had a good personality. ( this was Sunday at 11:30 and the server was a small Caucasian gal) we LOVED her!  The manager ( the girl one) came over to use twice and asked how everything was. I think it's super important for the manager to go around and ask how everything is and how her staff is.  The food was amazing, we got the buffalo chicken sandwiches and skillet queso everything was stellar.  I will be back if I am in the Fremont area. Good job!!!!

Chili's has upped their game...really.  One great thing that's always been here--the chips and salsa..light crispy chips and a delightful light and tasty salsa.  Where they've been doing better is their menu..they've added several things such as the 5 types of chicken strips.  Very tasty and a pretty big dish..I like the fiery pepper flavored one..a little too salty, but was still decent for Chilis.   This union city location is great as I was able to watch the NBA finals from anywhere in the restaurant as they have tvs in all the corners.
Very disappointing when you walk in this restaurant and the first reaction for all the employees is to just ignore you instead of seating you. As well with a 0 wait time we decided to leave.

Today is National Hamburger Day and in order to get this only for 5/28/17 you must say it to the waiter. It includes salad, hamburger and a mini lava cake. It was slow today and the service was okay. This place is usually packed on weekends. I would say everything was average. They have a new chicken menu which the chicken strips are good Here are a few pics of Chili the salad was good, the new fries were yummy and the hamburger good but a bit too greasy for me and finally the mini lava was delicious!

I called in no later than 8:30 last night letting the staff know that roughly 20 people will be dining at 9:30. Whether they take reservations or not, it would be nice for them to know so they could sort of move tables around. We arrived promptly at 9:30 and were told that the previous party was not finished. We looked over to the area and they were finishing up and chatting. Thats fine! Saturday night everyone wants to have a good time. But here's the problem... Half of the restaurant on the other side near the restroom was EMPTY. He told us that we were going to split up in fours but he said that area is closed... Really? Half the restaurant? Alright maybe someone took the night off. But given that one huge party is just chilling there I'm sure they waiters could manage to seat us real quick and take our orders. We waited over half an hour. The host kept telling us I'm sorry we are waiting for the previous party, we can't just kick them out. You could have told us a time frame.... Did someone just order another beer? Okay perhaps another half hour. 20 people, average dish is $15 or so, another +$3 for drinks... You do the math for your loss of the night.

I've been coming here once a week for the last few months, the food is great and the service is what keeps us coming back. Melissa is absolutely the best, she's always so friendly and super attentive. We actually request to sit in her section now. So appreciative of the great customer service!

The management- if you're server already has a table of 12. I would think you would have more than one server assist them so that your server is not overwhelmed and we are not just sitting and waiting.  I am not made at our server for forgetting about us. I truly feel he was overwhelmed with the number of people he had to serve and that the management should have had more assistance for him.  Orders were wrong. Food was not hot at all.  The noise level is loud inside to the point that you find yourself yelling in order to have a conversation.

Worst experience. One of the waitresses here on a Saturday night needs some serious retraining. Ordered. Food came out spread 20 minutes apart. Order was wrong. Couldn't find waitress. Waitress takes it back, but doesn't remove the charge for price adjustment (original order was cheaper). Bill comes out for $89, when she comes back it's $94 something; she couldn't explain the discrepancy/increase and was generally incompetent and rude cutting me off when I was trying to explain that we were overcharged. Dumb. Food also wasn't great. Fajitas steak and shrimp came with 3 tiny pieces of steak.

This is a first for me... I've always enjoyed going to Chili's but tonight has really left me with a bad taste in my mouth. After waiting an hour for our food, it came out cold. This was after we asked how long would the food take was when we finally got it. The guacamole for two of our plates were brown... that tells you how long the food had been sitting. My onion rings were Luke warm and my burger Patty was cold. I will not return to this location again. The manager came out to apologize and she was speechless.

Waited 20 min for table , got a table , waited 10 to be noticed ,one of the table cleaners too our drink order and that took a long while too.After 45 minutes here without seeing our food we got up and left.The system does not work as it should  they are understaffed here.sorry but u didn't earn better score.The food is also below average.

Not sure why this Chili's has such a low overall rating.. I have been here a few times and always sit in the bar area. I like to watch games (basketball, baseball, football) if they are on and the service is always really fast. This is a good place to get a burger and a beer and watch the game!

Worst Food and service I have ever experienced. It was not busy and it took over an hour to get our food after we asked how much longer it would be. When we finally received 3 out of our 6 plates the food was cold. The silverware we asked for never came. The manager was speechless on the service and quality of food. We walked out.  Used to love chili's but their service and food have gone down hill. Will not be returning to this location ever again.

I used to like this place a lot, food used to be good value for money. However, I had a horrible overall experience today! We were told wait time is 5-10 minutes, but ended up waiting for 40 minutes or so. After getting the table, food order was prompt. But it took ages for the food to come to table, and when it came, some of the food were out cold. And, to top it all, there was absolutely no apology for the long delay to get the table or the food. Not going back ever.

First off, I want to say that I have been here many times and always enjoyed the food, drinks and experience. This review is for my most recent visit. I went with a few girlfriends on a weeknight to get a drink 45 minutes before closing time. As soon as we came in, a server told us that it was last call (?!!). They tried to rush our order. We ordered margaritas and the server didn't even ask if we wanted them blended or on the rocks. As a result, we were served blended drinks (which is the default??). In the end, we were trying to pay using the tablet on our table and it didn't have batteries. The manager stuck around our table to make sure that it worked and we paid. All the while our group was trying to have a conversation..  Long story short- don't come here after 9.30 pm. Go to elephant bar instead.

Five stars for the food but -3 for the manager. I came here with a friend a few months back and when we were finished eating the manager came over and asked us to take their survey online. Fine. But while we were taking the survey she kept sticking her face in our phones and telling us what options to select (of course all stellar ratings which I was planning to give anyway) but because of that I gave a terrible review. Fast forward to today when my mom and I came in, we were greeted by the same manager who rudely stared at us and sat us more or less without saying a word.  We've been coming to this Chilis location for as long as I can remember but after this second bad experience I have concerns about returning. Hopefully this manager cleans up her act because this is the best and most effective way to lose loyal customers and give your location a bad reputation.

The service here has changed dramatically since the last time I came here. I believe they have hired new workers since there is new fresh faces with nice and positive work ethics. Our waiter was sweet and had our food out on time also refilled our drinks without asking. Food was good, deducting one star since the guacamole wasn't as yummy. Hopefully they keep this up

Unbelievably slow service. Granted we were there on a Friday but way past the dinner crowd. Food gets the stars. Nothing to brag about. We had to ask for someone to help us at our table. Once the food is serviced, they don't come back asking for water refills or if we need anything else. They really have to up their game to get more business.

The worst experience ive ever had.  I went in to order the 3 meat plate. (Ribs, chicken, sausage) order dry rub.  And 20 min later they bring me old Fry's undercooked chicken and some ribs that have already been cooked with new seasoning sprinkled on top.  I asked to speak to a manager.  Kiki the manager showed up and was dismissive and unapologetic.   Instead of admitting the fault just suggested the can cook it longer.  Thoroughly disgusted by the notion that putting it back in the oven was going to make it better and insulting my intelligence top the cake.   Ive given them business for over 27 years and this was the final straw.  Their service has gone way down. The cooking is horrible.  They keep changing the menu hoping to draw a new crowd. But if the food doesnt get better and the service continues to suck.  I expect this place to shutdown like the elephant bar did!

The margaritas at Chilis always a win!! The presidente margarita to be exact. In Mexico or the USA they are the best! Thats why I come here mainly!!! Lol (dont judge) but the buffalo salad and burgers are always good. The down side the bathrooms are usually dirty here and sometimes the waiters slow. Kid friendly and they have games to keep them busy.

Worst display of human decency. The man being helped at the to go counter before me was clearly mentally handicapped and the manger and girl working at the counter were not interested in helping him! They took forever to get him his order. Finally the guy gets his order and asks for a side of ranch. The younger girl working the counter goes to get him a large side of ranch no problem but the manger walks up and says it's $0.76!! The guy does not understand so the manager just slides right over to me and asks for my name and proceeds to get my order together. Neither one of them will make eye contact with the guy!! This goes on for almost 5 minutes! I finally had to ask her to add his ranch to my order so I can put an end to this ridiculously awkward situation!  I'm appalled at the severe lack of Customer service not to mention their lack of basic human decency. I will not be returning. Shame on Chilis.
We love chilis! Fariba is the best manager! Always taking care of me and my coworker!! The only chilis we will go to!

Pathetic service. They dont even cover the basics like having someone seat you, get you water when you ask for it etc etc. Just go to some other location if you really want to eat at chili's. This one really doesn't deserve any business.

Don't go to this place!   Just had a lunch today with shrimp and chicken meat cooked raw and had diarrhea later in the afternoon.    They did not charge me but still don't bet your health on this place!

I have never had any problems with this location until earlier today. My sisters and I went to this location for dinner, the hostess and waitresses were nice, we didn't have a problem with them. The management however, was so incredibly rude. I'm upset that we never caught his name. My sister brought her newborn baby to dinner with us in the car seat and stroller. The manager sat us a booth, no area available for us to scoot the stroller into. He immediately told my sister that she could not have her stroller and to take her seat out. My sister said she didn't feel comfortable placing her newborn on an uneven booth seat. She set her on the seat, the car seat did not fit. She turned and told him that she didn't feel comfortable AGAIN. He pulled the table out and her baby's seat dropped a few inches. This shook the baby and woke her up. My sister expressed that she'd feel much more comfortable at a table with chairs and the manager told her that he could not seat us there. We looked around, it was not crowded. There were two men in a six seater table right across from us. We didn't understand why he couldn't seat us elsewhere. My sister gave in and sat down with her child to calm her down. Throughout our evening, the manager would walk by and stare at her and her baby, every single time her walked passed or near our table. My sister felt uncomfortable and unwelcome. The food was decent, the waitstaff were kind. But we were in shock of how terrible the manager had treated us and how he treated my sister and her newborn. We will not be coming back to this location again.

It's a Chilis, every place can be different and can have a different experience every time. For the most part when I come here, the food is decent, the service is decent. Don't get me wrong, I have had both bad service and bad food at this location, but for the most part I have a good time and that's why I keep going back.

Had a horrible experience yesterday. Chilli's has been one of my favorites places for a long time. Went to eat in the evening and there was no wait and not that crowded. We ended up being there 2 hours and not by choice!! The food took about hour and a half!! We had 4 people (two were kids) and waitress said kitchen was backed up. I understand it happens but i watched other tables that came in after us getting served and leaving, while my table didn't food! Then 3 people in my party got their food and mine came like 15 minutes later!! I ordered what i usually get which was chicken crispers (my son got the same thing) They were nasty. Way to oily, didn't taste like they usually do. I started getting Nauseated​ from it and couldn't even eat it. My son didn't eat his either. I complained to waitress and she went to get manager...20 minutes later no manager. Then i had to wave down waitress and asked her for our check. We had dessert but asked for it to go. My kids couldn't sit any longer. She leaves to get it and i don't see her rush to get us out or trying to get manager. She is helping other tables. Finally she comes back with dessert to go and we give her credit card. We are clearly upset and want to leave. Then she starts cleaning the table!!! I have to tell her can you please just run the card we need to go, we have been here for 2 hours and my kids can't sit any longer!! Oh ya and still no manager we pay for everything and didn't even eat 2 of the plates! Thanks for the horrible experience...I definitely won't be returning.
Overall average experience. Been here a couple of times. The drinks are just ok and not always made from fresh ingredients.

Worst service in All of Fremont, perhaps the bay area.  Most Chili's pride themselves of service, but this Chili's fails at providing any kind of customer service.   No nothing!  The waiters/waitresses are depressing and I am sure their numbers show.  Maybe management needs a morale boost! ALL the waiters look like they hate life and treat you like it's Your fault!  Yelpers beware!

After running a few errands and getting some shopping done during the holidays, my son and I decided to stop by this location to have dinner.  There didn't seem to be too many cars in the parking lot but the place was actually pretty packed.  We waited for a short period of time and then got seated in a small booth.  My son was happy that they had a tablet on the table for him to play with and I was happy that they had a two for $20 meal.  I ordered the baby back ribs for my son and I got a sirloin steak for about $2 extra.  The appetizer was good but my mashed potatoes tasted pretty bad.  Service was friendly but scarce.  I waited for about 10 minutes for the waitress to bring me the check, only to be told that I could have paid it on the tablet.

I came here today with few friends to watch the NFL games. The bar is run by some dirty Morons hipsters dirty counters sticky tables. You order a beer and it comes all dripping top to bottom side to side. The food is not that far from the bar everything is cooked to death and overly greasy. I ordered My cheese burger and it was cooked to death looked like a hockey puck and tasted like dirt. The French fires are super salty and soggy wet. They no longer offer shakes he informed me that its wasn't being used and looks pretty nasty thanks for the honesty. Least to say I won't be going back even for a drink or to watch any games. I remember when I was younger and I use to look forward going there with my family it sure has changed for the worst. I can definitely see this place being shutdown sometimes near future. Good luck With everything.

Very slow service - took 30 minutes to get a burger. Then no server to be found for another 15 minutes . Still no server when time to pay. Overall bad experience. Spent over one hour to get a burger. Waste of time.....

We decided to give this Chilis another chance two days ago. Started off well -- we got seated right away. However, we sat at our table for ten minutes and never was acknowledged or got our drinks ordered. Three different waiters/waitresses walked by us a handful of times --nothing. We waited another five minutes and my husband decided that if this is the kind of service they give within the first fifteen minutes at a non-busy time, chances are they will mess up our order. So we walked out.
I ordered a bacon burger and onion rings and both were severely over cooked  unedable to say the least ....... the waiter was not friendly at all would I come back again ..? nope .....
Horrible service. Dirty plates and silverware. Good food but can't enjoy. Had to send dishes back 2 times. And I think they just came out dishwasher half way getting cleaned.

I just stopped by Chilis for dinner and noticed there were 4 or 5 tables available for seating 2 adults.  The host informed me that it would be a 10 - 15 minute wait even though I pointed to the empty tables.  Is management paying attention to this practice of keeping customers waiting when there are many tables available?  Needless to say, we left.  I will consider visiting Chilis perhaps in a year or two.  Does management need training on customer service?  How are the Chilis restaurants performing financially?  Are they growing or closing restaurants?  Amateurs.

Please please please avoid this place. Walked into the front door seated immediately, after we chased the hostess who left us far behind. Once seated it was another 10 minutes before we were ever greeted. Once our waiter Aimiee made it to our table she was most pleasant and helpful, offering what seemed to be genuine suggestions on menu choices. We placed our drink orders immediately. My counterpart at the table ordered a soda I got a mixed alcoholic drink. Three minutes later his soda came, it took my drink another 5 minutes since the bartender was new and had to "look up the recipe." We both ordered appetizers he got the make your own combo platter and I got the loaded fries. Even though our waitress was great about coming by to check on us, it took another 14 - 16 minutes to get our appetizers. When they arrived my cheese was already cold and I had to chip it off the skillet , the fries were dry and the plate was not at a proper serving temperature. My counterparts platter had the cheese bites as well which were not warm either making them chewy and almost inedible. After about 10 minutes of trying to consume this inedible platter we requested the check to leave. I was utterly disappointed. Maybe some better teamwork, and better cooks would help. Most of the food smelled awesome but the end product we received was worse than lacking. If I had noticed someone that appeared to be a manager I would have stopped them to complain, but since I didn't I chalked this lesson up to NEVER EAT AT CHILIS AGAIN! The only saving grace was our awesome waitress who seemed quite overwhelmed. Will not return and would NEVER recommend anyone comes here either. Too bad the menu looked beautiful while reality was really ugly. Funny enough the place was packed when we left so maybe this was a isolated experience, but looking at the reviews, maybe not.

I am here to defend the greatest establishment erected on god's chosen parcel of land known as the Fremont Hub Chili's Bar & Grill. There are few pleasures in life quite like accumulating a massive amount of Chili's rewards points, a frosty beer, some happy hour apps, a waiter that stays out of your goddamned way and lets you watch the Sharks/A's/Warriors in peace. Shout out to my main man Jeff keeping the service real in the bar lounge - it is my hope that one day they promote you to Senior Vice President of Operations. I can't speak for the rest of the restaurant - never ate in there before. I frequent the bar area because I can't stand children and I'm an ogre troll who needs alcohol. So there's that. Consistency - there isn't a lot of consistency in this world. Yelp is filled with Bay-Area "cultured" snobs who sit behind a monitor and bitch about how their lava cake wasn't "heated properly". Unless you're the grandchild of Jean-Georges Vongerichten trust us all that your assessment of the proper technique in cooking a lava cake has fallen on deaf ears. If anyone comes on Yelp and decides I can't visit this establishment due to the "lava cake review" by [anonymous for prosperity's sake] then GOOD. Chili's doesn't need you - and I don't need you taking up the valuable seat real estate in the bar area. This is Chili's friends. This isn't Gary Danko. It's a little thing called southwestern eggrolls and a nice humble slice of life. That's all it ever will be. You're either down with it or not. Either move along and post your next riveting review of the Fremont Blvd. Kentucky Fried Chicken, or meet me at the bar. I'll be the one propped up on a pile of Chili's rewards points eating the triple dipper, watching the game and singing the songs of my ancestors.

I agree with many, the service is slow. Sometimes they seem to forget you.  My daughter and I went late afternoon, hardly people inside.  Wasn't busy to delay at all. Last time, the guy seemed all down to serve us. Not happy.  Haven't been back since then. Now we have a gift card, I guess the ribs are calling, they have good deals. If service was improved and maybe more enthusiastic servers, would be a great place.   Too bad, we really like some of the food.

This location definitely stepped up its service from the last time I reviewed this place. I came here with my husband on Monday or Tuesday, I can't remember which. It wasn't busy, which is sort of a surprise because the Warriors game was on that night and I thought it'd be busier. Anyway, we ordered the 2 for $20 deal. For our appetizer, we got the deep fried pickles and for our 2 entrees, I got the 6 oz. sirloin (medium rare) with loaded mashed potatoes and black beans and my husband got the chicken and pork fajitas. I am REALLY digging the new menu! The deep fried pickles were SO good. I still prefer Buffalo Wild Wing's deep fried pickles, but I'd say Chili's takes 2nd place in my heart for it. I love pickles, if you couldn't tell lol. Chili's also improved their steak (at least I feel like they did) as far as taste and tenderness goes (I cut through the steak like butter, it was awesome). The loaded mash potatoes were a bit much because they put it in a mini skillet and I wasn't expecting it to be so heavy? But it was still pretty good and wasn't bland. Black beans were on point, as always. My husband DEFINITELY enjoyed his fajita dish. He used to work as a cook at Chipotle so he knows what fajitas are supposed to taste like and he was just like "THIS is how you cook them. The cooks at Chipotle now just overcook them and it leaves a bad taste, but THIS is the one." He definitely loved the pork more than the chicken, and I would have to agree on that. I tried the pork and it was full of flavor! Definitely going to get the fajitas next time we come by. Service and food overall has changed a lot and I'm glad it did.

Came in here for lunch at 12:30 on a Sunday. The place was pretty much empty. Was told by the host that it would be a 5 to 10 minute wait. Waited almost 15 minutes for a table. Another five for anyone to come and take a drink order. Felt rushed by the server.

Whoa!  Major changes here.  It was apparent that they've done some work to improve what had been an awful noise level and it's made a huge difference!  Huge, I tell ya!  We could actually enjoy our dinner without getting headaches. We were looking for somewhere that had a good grilled chicken salad and checked Chili's menu online.  The online menu listed one that sounded good but when we got there and read the actual menu, it turned out that there were several.  I can't remember the actual "name" of mine but it had marinated grilled chicken and a quesadilla came with it, quartered and decoratively arranged around the salad.  It was a good size salad, too, and was more than I could eat.  Hubby had a different grilled chicken salad but I think his was a Southwest Chicken Salad and there was a bit of spiciness to it (something I would hate but that he said was "pretty good").  Mine would have been spicy too if I hadn't asked to change to a simple Ranch dressing, etc.  They made my salad exactly the way I'd asked for it and that was nice.   The service was very good and our meals came out fast.  Our table had a mini-computer terminal on it (some tables didn't have this) so we were able to pay (and complete a questionnaire) electronically and quickly.   Overall, this was an excellent experience.  Not only was the food very good, the entire process from ordering to eating to paying our bill was as smooth as a finely tuned machine. You can bet we'll be back!

After many many visits, we finally had a not so great experience at Chili's last night.. Last night - slow service, wish we could have had more refills on water, slow to bring our food out. We weren't in a rush so I didn't fuss. I ordered buffalo wings with extra sauce on the side (I like 'em saucey, like me) and they came with no sauce at all. Instead of taking them back she brought the sauce in little to go containers. Granted the probably would have just poured the sauce over like I did, but sometimes a girl likes the fantasy that these were made special.  I wanted to redeem my birthday cake reward and it took about 30 minutes to figure out the process - waitress said I had top order it from the tablet and I couldn't. No, I didn't have the coupon (and didn't need one, I had checked the email before I left from home), there is no wi-fi so my 4G was hella slow to show the email (yes, no coupon needed). The manager finally came and explained the process, I had to order it and she had to put the order in so then it could be subtracted at checkout. He really should have come a lot sooner, or the waitress could have asked him just to comp it, I had my ID and could have verified my bday. Waitress was ok nice, nothing great unfortunately. Last night's visit would have gotten a 2 star review But all the other times we go - 5 stars -  we get great food (always order the southwest egg rolls, burger bites & wings) and great service. Good price/value for a family of 4
Last time we went to chilis it was at the UC location. But the fremont one is amazing. The service and food is so much better than the one at uc and our server Jessica was the best.

It's been years since I've stepped foot inside a Chili's...but when I do come here, I must have their molten chocolate cake.  I swear, no other place I know makes this better than Chili's.  Rich and creamy in the middle, topped off with a huge scoop of vanilla ice cream on top...my mouth is in heaven! But, other than that...I don't have much to say in terms of their rest of the menu...order the molten chocolate cake!!!  You won't regret it.

The food is as good as you'd expect from a chili's restaurant. I like it, it's not bad. The reason for its 1 star review is its staff... My girlfriend, my friend and I decided to go here one weekday night. But my friend needed to stop by his bank ATM (about 5 minute drive from chili's) so he was going to come in after us. We entered the restaurant 45 minutes before its closing time but we were not late. We ordered our food and as well as my friends food because we knew the restaurant was going to close soon. We got the food and everything but our friend still wasn't here. When he finally came, it was about 15 minutes before chili's closing time. But they wouldn't let our friend in. We even told them we are not going to order anything. We have everything we want. We had ordered his food too and it was getting cold. The manger was straight up rude and said I'm sorry I can't let him in. Again, the restaurant had not closed yet but the kitchen was closed.  Another incident happened when: I was having dinner with my sister's family. My sister had her 11 month old baby sitting on the table. The same manager came and said to please keep the baby off the table because people eat here. No shit captain obvious. Do you not clean the tables after? Ehhhhh.

Horrible! I came in with my family which was a total of 13 people with 2 people joining us later so really 15 but anyways we came in and we waited close to 45 minutes for someone just to acknowledge us or even get us water. Now ok, fine cool y'all are busy we get that but first off why is there only 2 servers for a normal busy night? So finally after somebody tries to get our drink orders, we wait another approximately 50 minutes for waters again and drinks. no luck. Our waitress is helping other tables and now its getting a bit annoying. So now we tell the manager about the problem, only then the waitress pays attention. So later our appetizers come out with our dinner a long time later and my family wasn't so happy but of course I just took it like "ok a miscommunication could happened, fine no problem". But then our food was just horrid where some dishes were cold or had minor things like no sauce or was the wrong dish size (from a dinner entree to appetizer size). Now no problem we just asked her if she could get us sauce please and it took her 30 minutes just to get a sauce again. So later as we are still eating she comes and asks if we want dessert to some of my family which I didn't get because they are still eating? How would somebody order dessert if somebody its still eating the dinner and appetizers you recently brought out. At this point my family and I couldn't believe what was going on with this waitress. The only somewhat accommodating person was the manager but I don't think we are giving our business again. Sorry.
Service was ehhh...food was okay. I still can't get over the fact that we were given dirty dishes with food residue left over from previous guests. Very disgusting. Will not be coming back at all.

Our server was so nice ! The food was pretty good. We got the dinner for 2, we got a Jixer or Margarita each, 2 full entrees, appetizer & a dessert for $35 the food was worth it, portions were pretty good & our food came out on a timely manner. I'm pretty impressed

Our server was fantastic. Our food sucked.  All three of our meals was way way overcooked.  Kid Mac n cheese was dry, kid cheese pizza was brown in several spot, and chicken sandwich had one end burned and the bun was crunchy.

This was my first time at Chili's and I'll just say I'm never going back. When we first walked in there was no one to welcome us in and have us seated and we waited about 5 minutes for a host to walk us to our table. We sat down (party of 3) and were served with our drinks. It took the server 20 minutes to take our order and another 20 minutes for the food. My moms ordered the Penne pasta with Shrimp and found chunks of pork in it. Beware that the menu has nothing mentioned about having pork in the pasta. Also we don't eat beef or pork so it was even worse knowing that they made such a huge mistake! The manager said they got their pans mixed up but that's no excuse. Will not be coming back.

Disturbing. The food was okay. The problem was the drinks. It wasn't until a couple of sips later that we realized there was lipstick still on the rim of the glass. Seriously?! That's so nasty that they can't even clean their dishes properly. What's even worse was that when the server came back with a fresh glass there was some sort of speck of food on the rim next to the handle! Really?!!!

I always think it's weird to review chains... You know what to expect with the food. Service has almost always been great at this location. Great place to go to watch sports or catch a quick meal. If you have a little one and they wanna play with the tablet thingy on the table, make sure they don't buy any games or order any food.....

It's been awhile since we were here and I doubt we will be back any time soon.  We went here for an early Friday night dinner and were not impressed. The food size has gone down and no prices are listed in the menu for either mixed drinks or desserts.  The food and beverages we had were OK but we both remember things being fresher in the past.   Every table has a tablet device.  We were told by our server that it was more convenient for her if we used it.  We declined. This used to be a decent place.  Too bad it isn't any more.

Average American bar food.  Expect $10-$15 per person for a meal.  I did the Chili's to-go here and got three appetizers for $12.  It was definitely quite filling but not super healthy obviously.  I wouldn't come here for gourmet food, but this will do for casual dining.  I used to like going to Chili's all the time as a teenager, and I'm not sure why now... The potato skins are quite good but they give you three, which is a lot!  They go well with the sour cream. The boneless chicken wings are so so.  They are quite small and drenched in sauce. The spinach and artichoke dip was decent too. I had to wait about 20 minutes for the food, which seemed like a long time for appetizers.  I thought these would be ready to go but I guess not!
Loved the burgers and the customer service was really friendly! Although, prices are high!
Food is decent but they never seem to have enough staff working. Many empty tables yet we're waiting 15 minutes to be sat.

Terrible service. Takes an hour to take my order and get my food. I sat by the kitchen and the staff were gossiping so loud right behind me. I usually have patience when it comes to situations like this, but I'm angry enough to be writing this live from the restaurant. Really upset with everything overall. Hope the food was worth the wait.

I keep forgetting not to come here. The food is bland, serving sizes have been reduced significantly and the service is mediocre. I remember the fajitas been decent but now the have no flavor and you only get 3 tortillas. Check the comparison picture i uploaded between what the show in the nenu and what you're actually being served.

This Chili's was a very regular place for me throughout my college days. And even now it's still a place I consider going to every now and then. Similar Menu to every other Chilis, but the atmosphere at this location is slightly better than the one closer in Union Landing. Customer Service has always been something you felt more consistently at a higher standard here as well. Food is also A-Okay, and the service is usually relatively fast, and they usually make up for mistakes. I would be giving this four stars, but recent implementation of a 'Entertainment Screen', they have often charged us an extra dollar for using it, despite us never touching it. It's a pretty inaccurate system as if anyone toys with it before you're seated, it's assumed you're using it. This had occurred the last 4/4 times we've been here, so I felt that merited a -1 star. Still probably one of the better 'American' chains you can go to in Fremont though.
Me and my wife waited ten minutes before someone greeted us while workers were standing around talking the whole time with each other service sucks! I will never eat there again

Worst service ever.  My food came cold, my daughter's was fine.  Waiter didn't come by for 20 minutes to check on us ( we were in the bar area so that didnt make sense)  She was pretty much finished by then.  He asked if he could get me a new plate and acted as though he was doing me a favor.  When I  said no he gave the sucks to be you look.  Completely disgusted.

I frequent restaurants like Chili's and Applebees since their food is pretty good and the price is fair for the most part. Last night, we went to this Chili's but service was really subpar. Our waitress took over 20 minutes to greet us, meanwhile all the other tables around us were being served/taken care of. When she finally took our order for the drinks, it took another 10ish minutes to get it.... and she left without taking our orders for another 10-15 minutes. It seemed most efficient/productive to me that she should have taken our orders while she was still at our table.. Right? Busy or not, at least put in our orders first so at least they can start making it! Finally after another 15 minutes, we got our food. There was no way to flag her down either since she walked by without ever looking at us. On top of all this, she even forgot to bring us one of the things we ordered... And then at the end, when we were paying our bill, she was suddenly friendly with us trying to get a good tip out of us.. We were all so baffled by her sudden change in attitude. Regardless of it all, we still tipped her the normal 15% because it was the right thing to do. (We sat on the right side of the restaurant, after entering, at a table near the window and our waitress was white) The food came out freshly made which is something I always appreciate, however the service really put a bad taste in my mouth.  Spinach artichoke dip is rreally good. Chicken tortilla soup is really good too. Southwest Chicken Soup wasn't great though, there was a ton of potato in my really small cup of soup and it eventually soaked up all the soup before I could finish it. Finally, the chicken enchiladas entree was good enough.. I've definitely had better.  For noticeably better service, I would probably go to Applebees since we can do most of our ordering from the little digital thing on our table.. As well as call our waiter/waitress with it. Maybe I'd order to-go from Chili's every once in awhile or go to a different location!
Poor service, which is typical Chili's. I seriously only come when I get free appetizers in my email.

The server Michael was wonderful along with the service. Our food came out so fast and he made sure everything was right. This is a good place to go when you need to have a quick lunch. They even had all 6 T.Vs on and they all had the current sports on for everyone to watch. Thank you Chili's for Michael and his wonderful service.

I have over 30 check-ins at this location (not counting the many times I have forgotten to check in).  You can say I am a regular. Even after they changed the menu and removed some of my favorites (Monterey Chicken, Country Fried Steak) I still come here because we usually get good service.  The past few visits we have been given over 30 minute wait times. Half the restaurant is closed off for some reason.  I don't usually leave comments but I hate seeing my "go-to" restaurant go down the tubes.  Hopefully Chilis management will read this.  With New restaurants popping in Fremont, Chilis should look into a better customer experience.

Horrible!!! I've been a long time patron here, as a Fremont native, for like 20 years. And to my dismay the past two times I have been (in the span of a month, by the way) we had TO WALK OUT. Why? Because we never even got served. Yes, twice. In a month!!  It really saddens me to say this because I had a lot of great memories here growing up. For a couple years in a row I celebrated birthdays and other milestones at this locale. Not anymore. I remember the old owner/manager was very professional. He had his name and phone number posted by the entrance a while back. Now it seems to have changed hands and the service is just abysmal.  Today we went in. Waited. Waited. Waited. Place was deserted except for the bar. No one came to seat us. We asked the bartender if we could be seated. She went to get someone. A lady (in jeans and unprofessional attire) comes out and asks how many. We tell her 2 and her response? Take a seat and wait a few minutes. Yup!! When the place was DEAD. 75% empty tables on one side and absolute emptiness on other next to bathrooms. We shook our heads and flat out walked out. The other time we got poor service, about 3 weeks ago, we at least got seated and that's as far as things went. So, another horrible experience, we really are never going back until the management changes. I absolutely refuse to give money to a place that makes it crystal clear it doesn't care if I eat there again.
Long wait to order, waiter no where to be found, workers seemed to not like working there, place wasn't to clean ,food wasn't that great lucky to get a star

Everytime I come in the staff seems annoyed that there are any customers in the restaurant. Always has a wait with half the restaurant empty because they do not have enough staff. Food orders take extremely long or all of your food (drinks, apps, main course) comes at once.  I have asked on a few different items why the food doesn't come out with the sauces described in the menu and the food runners just stare at you like they have no idea what you are asking.

I would kill myself to come here again and again for the premium customer service. What I am impressed and I was touched by Fariba & Mel service and they absolutely food was great and we will repeat to come here again.

They told my sister that is in a wheelchair that she was a fire hazard. Ah excuse me last time I checked your business is by law supposed to be able to service those in a handicapped situation, no matter race, age, religion, or the gender. So that fact that they refuse to service us , was not only unethical, but unconstitutional. So I do not recommend this un-American and in holy place upon my worst enemy.

This place is The best place to go if you want great service animals very nice servers One that I recommend as a server is Christian and the manager feriba l that is very sweet and nice the best food,great service their fajitas are the best always go to chilis if you want the best food been going no there for 36 years

First time back in 5 years as previously not good.  I ordered the new Texas ribs.  They arrived still ice cold in the middle.  Obviously a locally heated frozen concoction from a factory.  Could not get waiter's attention so after 10 minutes I walked the plate up to the host who took them back to kitchen.  10 minutes later a new batch arrived that was warm on the outside but only lukewarm on the indide.  The flavor was a bit musty tasting so I didn't finish eating as I was afraid to eat them.  My wife ordered a Mexican plate combo.  The guacamoli had jalapeño peppers in it so she couldn't enjoy it.  The steak chunks were dried up and over cooked and not chewable.  The very tiny shrimp were rubbery.  It will be at least another 5 years before we will try eating here again.  I am sure it will go out of business by then, as the food and especially the service cannot get much worce.

We had the worst experience at this Chilis. After waiting 30 min when it was not busy we were finally seated. Another 10 min wait. No one ever came to take our drink order or say I'll be with you in a moment.  Appetizer came after the entree. Entree order were mixed up, not what we had ordered. Never received an apology. When I complained. An $18.00 discount was said to be given but the bill was 5.00 more than before I complained.  Not returning to Chilis.

Swear this is the last time I come here. Wednesday night, my wife's birthday and two kids with us. Half the goddamn restaurant is empty because you don't want to pay more servers minimum wage, you'll make your customers wait 20 mins at 8:30 on a Wednesday night. Second time this happened. Horrible service

Horrible service. It took us 1 hr to get our food and another 30 mins for dessert.  Since we were stuck with the 3 course dinner option we had picked. Add to this the wait time. 2 hrs of total waste. I let it slide the first time it happened and came back again.but this time around it took these guys even longer. Certainly never coming back again. Hope the management would hire some more cooks.
Horrible service!! Tables and menus were filthy. Waited over an hour for my food. The area were sat in smelled like a dirty diaper. My food finally came and it was not what I ordered.

As far as chain restaurants go, Chilis is actually pretty good.  We hadn't been in years and couldn't pick a restaurant so we decided to come here. They have definitely modernized - TVs everywhere and mini tablets on every table. These were all a bit distracting so we pushed our tablet to the side. I could see it being good for watching a game though. They have a $20 dinner for 2 deal where you get an appetizer and each get an entree. Pretty good deal if you ask me. We got the chips and salsa (which were still bottomless in this deal to my delight), and the bacon burger and the carnitas fajitas. The fajitas were great and it was TONs of food. The burger was a good burger but you couldn't really taste the bacon.  Will definitely be coming back here to either watch a game or just when we have a craving for American food. Oh and their margaritas look amazing so I can't wait to try those either!

I came here with my son and his wife and there kids. They waited 1 hour before there food arrived.  I didn't order any food because the asked me to come after I already ate. There server did the best she could trying to help us out. It was more so the kitchen that had issues. We spoke to the manager and she seemed to have a bit of a attitude. I am glad it wasn't my food I was waiting for because I would of raised hell. What gets me is I have been to busier restaurants and had the food in front of me with in 15 minutes. Only half the restaurant was filled. There food was also old. I will never eat at this restaurant.

Love Chili's from their burgers to their margaritas. My son just LOVES their guacamole burgers. Too bad they don't have a Chili's near Hayward where i live. Try their triple berry margarita OMG to die for!!!!! Service is amazing. A great place to come on your own or bring your kids. Great menu and music!!!!! A great place to relieve all that stress and just relax in a fun environment. Check it out.

location: East San Jose, San Jose, CA
review: I've lunched numerous times at this Chilis location and their food and service has always been pleasing. I usually order the guacamole burger, which comes with fries as a side. The burger isn't always the best, however, for the price, it's a good deal. Employees provide fast and kind service like always.

They only get one star, because I can't give them zeros stars. We walked in with a big party of 17, and asked if we could be seated. With a tiny bit over an hour before closing.To which the manager (a small thin older lady with glasses) said they couldn't sit us. They weren't busy, there was a lot or room throughout the whole restaurant. But they had already closed off 3/4 areas in the restaurant. I told the manager we were willing to split up in half, or in groups of 5 to make it easier for them to serve us. She again stated there was no room for us. And when I asked about the 3 empty areas in the restaurant with clean tables and why we couldn't sit there, she began to mumble and then nodded her head no.
