She then told me, there was just one section available for us to eat and it was full and she pointed at that area. I looked over and there were two small parties of 5 eating there. And 4 other tables that were covered in dirty cups, plates, and used napkins. The reason that area was full was because those tables had been left dirty and not cleaned for who knows how long. So we couldn't sit there or in any other area of the restaurant. We tried hard to work with her, but ultimately, she didn't want to serve us, nor tried to help. She was being lazy  She kept saying "we weren't prepared" that's what annoyed me so much. Because they could of been prepared had they cleaned up tables or allowed us to sit in a different section! Her lack of effort saddened me.

Terrible service.  Went here on my birthday around 7:30 pm on a Monday with my husband and kids.  Stood at the front and about 4 or 5 servers passed us without acknowledging us.  Finally host shows up and says we have to wait 20 mins because 1/2 the restaurant is closed.  Even though the part that was not closed had 3 or 4 tables open.  When we pointed that out he went back to the kitchen to find out and said he'd be right back.  We could see him in the kitchen laughing and joking with someone.  Came back out after 5 minutes and gave us menus.  After 10 mins he seated us and tried to take the menus out of my kids hands and give them kids menus.  We sat there with no acknowledgement for 10 mins.  We got up and left and on the way out the same host said have a good night to us, not even realizing what happened.  Get some better management.

I need to give this place more credit than I ever have before. I have always hated chili's. The food was always crappy, the service was slow, and their drinks could have been sold as non alcoholic because they were so weak.  The last few times, though, chili's has really stepped it up. Their food has gotten so much better. Insanely better. It is actually edible without spending the whole next day or evening in the restroom. I applaud you, chili's.  Their service has been a bit better too. My service yesterday kinda stunk, but I feel like that always happens when you choose to sit in the bar area. The other sections seemed to have put some pep in their step. The bartender never seems to make it out to the table tops often enough. I suggest sitting at a table outside of that area. We got our food a bit cold, but because of what we ordered, it wasn't too bad. My buffalo boneless wings didn't have enough sauce on them...but the server brought me out an extra sauce for free, and that solved that problem.  While chili's is not my favorite by any means, I have it three stars because the quality of their food and menu items seemed to have gotten a bit better. I can definitely go back with less hesitation and think I'll find something I like!

This is a long review, but I think worthwhile to those who read it.  (I especially hope our server, Sophia, reads this...and the manager, Fariba.) My Wife and I walked in, there was no waiting. Friday at 0720. We were seated within 10 minutes, since we were a twosome, and had to wait for a two-top to get bussed. No problem. We were seated, and approached by our waitress, Sophia. I asked her some questions regarding the draught selection. I think I might have confused her, because 10 minutes later, our drinks came and I got a Sam Adams, instead of the Sierra Nevada I decided on. My Wife got her drink as ordered, and we were apologised to by Sophia for the time it took, and for her lack of knowledge regarding the beer selection. Not a problem, I can be a bit of a beer guy, and accepted I must have confused her. I decided to enjoy the Sam Adams she brought me, since I didn't want to wait another ten minutes. She proceeded to take our order, and everything was fine in my book. We received our appetizer, and were done and waiting for our menu order. Clock was about 35 minutes in from ordering. My Wife ordered carnitas/shrimp fajitas. I ordered steak/chicken. (I am uploading pics of my dish, to follow.) My Wife was brought her entree, with her tortillas. I was told by my server that the kitchen had made a mistake with my order, and were fixing it. Still, I was fine with that. By the time my order came out ten minutes later, I was disappointed at the dish placed in front of me, and that my tortillas were now dry/cold. My Wife was waiting, since my meal had not been brought out, but I convinced her to go eat without me. I looked at my meal, and asked a server for a menu. I took pictures at what I ordered, and what I received, looked at my Wife sadly, and told her I couldn't eat it. A few moments later, I asked Sophia to speak to the manager. I also told her that my initial drink order was wrong, and that we would like another round of drinks. I made sure to be clear on my drink order this time. My Wife had changed her selection, and I wanted the SN I had originally ordered. I want to say that Sophia had been every bit as helpful, apologetic, cordial, and customer service minded, as she could be. The manager, Fariba, came to our table, and asked me about my issues. I began by defending our server first. It was not her fault my dinner looked the way it did...I mentioned that I did NOT want to put our waitress on trial, and that my issues were likely training oriented, food management oriented, and that I couldn't even bring myself to eat it. Charred, burned chunks of meat. And not much meat, at that. A TOTAL misrepresentation of the menu. So...while I didn't want to butcher anyone in this review...I will say the following happened...I was given excuses. I was told by the manager that she "knew right away by your complaint that Sophia doesn't know how to order drinks, and that you must be right." I was told, "Our food comes like that, and it won't always look like it does on the menu." I explained that I have been to numerous Chilli's restaurants, and it didn't look like that ANYWHERE. That I didn't need to hear blame placed on someone else to validate my complaints regarding our meal. I explained that I thought Sophia did EVERYTHING she could to deal with a situation, with the UTMOST respect for customer service.  The manager, Fariba, struck our dinners from our bill. That was a VERY good thing. She continued by trying to give me excuses for everything, told me how bad our waitress was, how she didn't know a hefeweizen from a half glass of water, that their food was packaged a certain way that was out of their control, that our waitress had a DEATH in the family just yesterday...she really threw her under the bus, and unjustly so. When Fariba, (the manager) tried to square it, she made no offers initially, only asked me over and over what I wanted. I told her to be fair, and make ME, the customer, an offer to make it right. When she paid for our meal (not drinks, mind you, which were also wrong) she asked if there was anything else I wanted. I told her I did not want our server fired tonight, due to what happened, that it wasn't her fault, and in fact, I felt it to be the fault of management.  So, in the end, I ended up taking home a to-go box of food I didn't want to eat, and paid about half our bill. After the manager left, I told Sophia I thought she acted in a great way. I asked if I could use her name in my Yelp review. She said yes. I felt terrible for her. We offered our condolences and prayers for her loss. My Wife and I tipped 45% to her. She stood up higher than everyone we encountered tonight. Including her manager, though I was happy Fariba took the time to speak with us, I left feeling she said too many things. Personal things. Excuses. To anyone that is looking for a server, Sophia is your BEST option. God bless her!

Rude people. We were there to pick up a to-go order, and they locked the side door and gestured for us to go all the way around, then when we went around no one greeted us and a girl working there gave us a rude look, so we started walking towards the cash register to pick up and pay for our to-go order but that rude girl stopped us and said we needed to wait to be seated - we weren't trying to be seated we just wanted our to-go order. Then when we walked up to the cash register to pick up and pay for our order we had to wait like 10 min with no one coming to see us, so we asked to pick up our order and finally got it. Never coming here again. Also there was a guy who clearly wanted a to-go order right as we left, the guy working there at the side door gestured for him to go aroynd, so the guy who was going to order to go just decided to leave instead, he looked angrier than me, looks like I'm not the only one experiencing this.

Went for dinner and left 15 minutes later without hearing from wait staff. It happened like this: my wife and I arrived and were taken to our table right away. However, no one came by to take our drink orders, not to mention our food orders. My wife and I waited for 15 minutes and the staff didn't even look at us... as a matter of fact, there were no wait staff in site. It seemed like a ghost town. Maybe the staff was playing hide-in-seek with the customers. Because of this horrible show of customer service, my wife and I left, since Chilis clearly did not want our business. After leaving Chili's we drove to The Counter - a burger place on Paseo Padre Parkway and Walnut in Fremont. The customer service is much better than Chilis and the wait staff were happy to see us. I highly recommend going to The Counter over Chilis, were the wait staff is not pretending to be the Loch Ness Monster and showing itself only on rare occasions.

I figured I haven't been here in a long time so it would be a great place to go with my 6yr old for lunch.  It's around 130pm, As soon as you walk in you are greeted by a hostess who will take you to your seat. The place is bare, only about 6 tables with patrons. I figure food should come out quick. I barely sat down and he asks if I'm ready to order, ugggh no? There's s tablet device on the table that has games and you can order food. No one explained it to me.  I ordered a bottomless soup and salad and my son got a grilled cheese. It took 20+ minutes for our food to come out. The waiter never checked back or asked if I needed anything. I had to flag him down to get my next soup.  As for the food, the quality has gone down. The chicken tortilla soup looked like something out of a can or powder form. The chicken didn't taste fresh but frozen.  The "new" fresca salad was organic greens with quest fresco sprinkled on top, that was it.  This was one of the most disgusting meals I e ever had and it was only soup and salad! Huge disappointment. It was pretty sad.  My sons grilled cheese was burned on one side as Well.  I definitely will not be coming back and i for sure will not be tipping.

SOOOOOO I've been here twice now where I told the servers it was my mother's and husbands birthday (separate occasions) and asked if they could bring a scoop of ice cream put because you now have to ask it from what my friend has told me. I guess she went there and didn't know so she didn't get anything. So I requested it, both times, and nothing. Both of our servers had been rude and the first occasion on my mother's birthday she asked our server for a mojito. We didn't know they don't serve that there but he said ok. When the drinks came out he gave her a Coke and when she said she ordered a mojito he just said "I know, we don't serve them." Why the flying f*ck couldn't you say that? My husbands birthday had another dull server and nothing for the birthday dessert. I just got off the phone with the manager and told her on both occasions I asked for a scoop of ice cream for both birthdays to which she replied "Well, if that did actually happen I would be surprised." Yes it happened, I'm not lying. Don't say 'if' because you're making it too obvious that you're accusing a customer of lying, they teach you that at any job. Talking to her was useless and just kept on saying ok I understand. No sorry or anything. I've been coming here forever and since I was about 7. I'm 22 now and I used to like coming here with friends and family but I wouldn't even take anyone anymore.

The food here is alright, it's the service that was killing me. Me and my family didnt wait too long for our table, but when we decided on what to order no waiter/waitress even bothered to say "hello! Welcome to Chili's", we were just sitting there for almost 1 hr and I was starving. I really hope they'll pay more attention to not most of their customers, but all of them. Come here if you'd like, but I suggest going to a different Chili's or just dont even go to Chili's, most of the time their service is bad no matter where you go. I reall really hope they can train their staff better.

Outstanding service by Megan. My daughter and I felt like royalty! Service was amazing. Food wow! Really updated menu and several food styles. I would work here if they needed someone in management. The vibe is awesome and I am on a date with my 8 year old.

Chili's isn't exactly my first choice when looking to dine out, but my friend had a gift card he needed to use so I went ahead and joined him. I haven't been here since the latest redesign and it looks ok, a few more flat screen tv's to appeal to the sports fan and a new small computer device at each table which gives you the option to view your bill and pay with your gift card or credit card, split the bill with friends and a few other features that I didn't check out. Nice. Our waitress was helpful and friendly and took our order, me and my friend decided to get the 2 for $20 deal, a choice of one appetizer and two entrees.  Choose an appetizer: * Spiced Panko Onion Rings * Fried Cheese * Tostada Chips & Salsa * Tostada Chips & Fresh Guacamole * Half Order of Texas Cheese Fries Choose an entree: * NEW Fajitas (Choose Grilled Chicken and/or Pork Carnitas) * Half Rack of Baby Back Ribs w/ Homestyle Fries (Choose Original or Memphis Dry Rub) * Mango-Chile Tilapia (Lighter Choice) * Mango-Chile Chicken (Lighter Choice) * Grilled Chicken Salad (Lighter Choice) * Classic Bacon Burger * Cajun Chicken Pasta * Margarita Grilled Chicken (Lighter Choice) * 6 oz. Classic Sirloin* (Also Available as Lighter Choice) * Bacon Ranch Chicken Quesadillas * Original Chicken Crispers® * Crispy Chicken Crispers® * Crispy Honey-Chipotle Chicken Crispers® We decided to get the spiced panko onion rings and each decided to get the Classic Sirloin, mine the 6 oz and my friend the 10 oz for $4 more For a Tuesday night, there were actually quite a few people dining out, but nothing like a weekend crowd that would be here. The kitchen seemed to be having troubles keeping up with orders because it seemed to have taken at least 15-20 min before our appetizer came out and another 10-15 min for our sirloin steaks. The onion rings were pretty good and served with a ranch dipping sauce. My sirloin steak, medium well was more well than medium and served with a side of steamed broccoli, cheesy mashed potatoes and a slice of buttered Texas toast. The toast seemed to be soaked in the butter garlic spread, maybe slightly more than I would put on.  Overall, for what you get, the 2 for $20 deal is a good value for what you get, but with many other better dining options in Fremont, I won't be coming back here too often.

My gf and I were seated around 830pm and the restaurant was at most a third full. 15 to 20 min pass and no one has come to take our drink order or to even say we will be right with you. the hostess then sat another couple in the booth behind us and I asked her if she could find our server as we have not been helped yet. with a scowl she says she will send our server over. she disappears to never be seen again and still no server. then we realize that the couple that just sat down is placing their drink and appetizer order and when the server is done with them she walks away and again doesn't talk to us so after 30 min of no service what so ever we decide just to get up and leave! I asked for the manager on the way out and told her why we were leaving and want happened. she didn't seem to care so we will not be going back to that location ever again
Your standard Chili's.  Bar is darker than the Batcave after the lights go out. I will say the beers are nice and cold though.

Horrible service unless you sit at the bar. Happy day on Sundays! The waiter we had in the bar section was named James.  He just started his shift when we got there so he was very talkative and efficient.  As the time passed he stopped checking our table, we had to ask him for water 3 times before he brought some and every time we asked for a water refill we were neglected. Overall the food was pretty standard, as were the drinks, but the service was horrid.  I recommend sitting at the bar in the bar, or at a normal table not in the bar area. I ended up leaving a $5.00 tip for the bartender on my $20.00 split check.

30 minute wait for lunch while not seating two entire sections. As a customer there's nothing more annoying than being told it's a half hour wait when half of the restaurant is empty and not being seated. Their inability to staff correctly during lunch is not our problem, not good business and will impact us choosing this restaurant for dinner or any other outings. Despite recent improvements in food quality, service has always been and continues to be a huge problem here.

These 5 stars are strictly for Greg! By far one of the best servers ever. My husband and I swear that we have a magnet on our heads for bad service which sucks especially because we have both been servers and know what good service should be.  Greg seemed to be running the place, he was the first to greet us and seated us immediately as we walked in the door. He is very friendly and attentive. We nicknamed him Houdini by the time we left. The refills that we never even had to ask for were on the table without us even noticing. So if you ever go to this Chilli's request Greg if you want excellent service.

It was recommended to me by a friend. I think she was not aware that it is not a vegetarian's heaven. But I really appreciate the staff for serving us vegetarian food, even if it was not on their menu. We ordered Chickenless Cajun Chicken Pasta, Margharita Flat Bread and Veg Fajitas. All in all, the food and service was good. I would definitely recommend this place for comfort-food.

I like coming to this chili's they have great ribs I.went to chili's today at 12,p.m. for lunch I.got the full rack of ribs man it was so good some time I always get the full rack of ribs the ribs fall right off the bone

This place used to be our "go to" spot whenever we just wanted some diner tex-mex americana food. Been going here since they built it. However, ever since the remodel last year it's been going downhill.   The service has gotten really bad. They either need to fire the apathetic teenagers/young adults or re-train them all.  They are indeed more concerned about their friends, drama & co-workers than service.   My friend and I ate in the bar in March figuring they couldn't screw up bar service. WRONG!!  Same issues as the dining area.  The food has become a hit or miss.  Plating is sloppy.  So, you add poor service w/sloppy plating & inconsistent food quality = not getting my $$$

HELLO OWNERS....YOU NEED TO TAKE NOTICE! The food, services and cleanliness is not good! Its obvious your servers could care less about the people they're serving or your families livelihood. Why do you allow this in your restaurant? Chilis used to be a go to spot for families but I will not be bringing my family back here again. We have given this Chilis too many chances and it's failed every time! Do something about it before you lose all your customers.  Tell you servers to clean the dang tables too!! SMH

I have to say that they are much better than they were before....I LOVE their chicken fajitas....Love their lunch menu and love their new Mexican options....I don't know what happened buy they are improved big time.....This is now one of my favorite places to go.....MMMMMMMM FAJITAS
Got a choclate lava meltdown - wasn't heated properly & the cake tasted stale.
I've been coming to Fremont Chilis for years.  Rich has been there as long as I've been going.  It's a staple of the Fremont Hub.  Stop in there for lunch or dinner.

Ordered, for pickup,  the Avocado Chicken Sandwich lunch combo with NO BACON and side of salad - the sandwich comes with fries. I picked up my order from this young lady with long blond hair - no pleasant greetings and I thought oh well she must be busy so didn't mind. Came to work and opened my order only to realize there's no fries. I called and the same girl picked up I let her know that my fries was missing and with no "apology" and with an attitude she said "oh well you replaced your fries with salad" to which I replied no I ordered the lunch combo and it comes with fries with a side of salad OR soup. She puts me on hold and the manager comes who was much nicer and says she's going to reduce my bill by 10% I said ok thanks and we hung up. First bite to my sandwich, (it's past 2pm and I'm starving) I realize there IS bacon in my sandwich!!!! I called back, the same young blond girl picks up I let her know I'm the person who called 1 min before and informed her that my order is totally wrong and that I had ordered WITHOUT bacon now I can't eat this sandwich and I'm left hungry. Her response, instead of a simple " oh we are really sorry about that......." puts me on hold, comes back and says " No problem we will give you a refund"!!! "no problem"??? I haven't done anything wrong that you are no "problem'ing" me. I wasn't that frustrated with the fact that they got the order wrong, I understand things happen but I was really disappointed and annoyed at her lack of customer service or common sense manners!! what is wrong with our young generation?? aren't their parents teaching them the basics of being a well mannered person??? and what's wrong with Chilies' management who is not teaching basic customer service to their employees??
This place went down  Hosts have no work ethics Service sucks Go else where way more better or decent places

This place sucks. The only reason we went was because we got a free chips and queso coupon just for signing up on their e-mail list. (Woohoo!)  The appetizer is normally 5 dollars and some change.  Even though it is good, I wouldn't pay that much for it; get the coupon instead.  The coupon does however require that you buy at least one entree with it.  It was about 930 when we got in, and the resto closes at 11.  The spot is remodeled, complete with new non-sticky, non-disgusting menus.  But don't judge a book by its cover.  We shared a burger, and got about 6 fries with it.  wtf.  but we figured it was because we got the free appetizer. fine then.  we requested ranch for all 6 of our fries, but the dressing was extremely watered down.  I was so thirsty from pigging out on all the salty food, but no water was to be found.  The employees are totally loud and lack professionalism as they tend to favor talking amongst each other in their loudest outside voice ever.   However, a plus was that when we ordered our burger medium  rare (bf likes his meat bloody), I didn't get the runs.

Very poor service!  The food was just okay. I ordered the chicken fajitas which were not bad, but I've had better. They were what I would expect from a restaurant that specializes in American food. However, our server spent far too much time standing around talking. And for a lunch hour, it took far too long for me to get my food. It took over 30 minutes for just the appetizer. And since I was limited on time, I had to take the rest of my meal to go. And when I finally got to finish my food away from the restaurant, I open my container to find that my order did not include everything that I asked and paid for.  Needless to say, I will not be coming back to this Chili's in a long time.

Came here for dinner and sat in the bar. Little did we know we would get the worst service. Two meals came out in a reasonable amount of time but the third meal didn't come out until the other two meals were completely finished. The manager brought out the food and try to suck up to us. She then came to talk to us about the meal being comped but she had the worst attitude about it and gave us a dirty look while at it. Don't know if I'll come back here after this experience.
We went to Chili's today and waited several minutes to be seated.  We were told by a staff that he would be with us shortly.  We waited,  nobody helped us, and we left.  We will not visit again.

Let's see where to start.. first let me state my overall experience was ohkay. That's why I gave the 2 stars. But let me say the staff there was very unprofessional.. I saw waitress practically arguing. The manager didn't even act like a manager. Though our waitress was prompt and took very good care of us. It was other staff and their drama. They had friends eating there and would approach they're peers speaking poorly of other patrons as well as other staff. I went to dine with my husband & sister in law. Not to witness the bad girls club inside a chili's. On to the food my burger was dry. My sister in laws pasta was ohkay, but the chicken in it was whatever's.  Overall..I'm over it. Staff acting unprofessional.. one guy even came out with a toothpick in his mouth, while talking to a patron..ewww  Basically I won't be back.. thanks

I honestly try to stay away from Chili's since I've had a handful of not so good experiences and last night wasn't any better. I had made a reservation for 7 at 7pm, expecting that by the time we arrive, our table would already be set up. When I told them about my reservation, it took them an extra 5-10 minutes to get us situated at a long, skinny table that could barely hold our entrees.  Since there were 7 of us, we ordered 3 "2 for $20" deals, while the odd man out ordered their own entree, the 6 oz steak with mashed potatoes and broccoli. We liked the appetizers (chips & guac, chips & salsa, and the cheese fries) but the entrees were pretty bad. My cousin and her friend ordered the chicken strips which were mostly breading and little chicken. I ordered the cajun chicken pasta, which I honestly could have made better at home. My uncle was annoyed since he could barely eat his burger with little to no elbow room since he was sitting at the head of the table. The sitting arrangement was not well thought out. It might have been better for a party of 4 or 5 but not 7. As for my aunt, she absolutely hated her steak. She stated that the texture didn't even feel like meat. She described the taste as having the steak cooked in water then grilled, which makes it seem like it was packaged or frozen or reused.  I don't seem myself coming back here any time soon. The only reason why we went was because my uncle suggested it. I would've preferred Elephant Bar or Applebee's or BJ's and I'm a little disappointed that I didn't speak up earlier but it is what it is. Please upgrade the quality of food and the layout of the restaurant and I might consider coming back.

Have to agree with the reviews pointing out the bad service. But tonight was the last straw. We waited 15 minutes for someone to come to the table and decided to leave and go to Popeyes. We have had bad service before but put up with it and the loud noises but I think I am done with this location.

Epic fail.  We visited today following our trip to the Art & Wine Festival, thinking Chili's would be a nice cool place to grab a relaxing bite to eat for ourselves and the kids before we went home. WRONG. When you walk into Chili's, at most locations its a sure bet they always have a super friendly (almost to a fault) host/hostess greeting customers and seating them. Usually its the same here, until now I guess. We weren't greeted at all, and the gal hostessing seemed like she hates her job. No smile, no enthusiasm, not even a neat clean appearance... She was outright rude and dirty looking, and her award winning personality was just as fantastically drab.   Once we were seated, our server (Karla per our receipt) meandered over a few minutes later to take our drink order, however did not introduce herself and seemed already in a rush... Although they were noticeably not slammed. She then brought our drinks (mind you giving a 7-year old an adult sized Strawberry Lemonade, which I wouldn't have allowed) and took our food order. We had been outside in the sun at a festival for HOURS, so I called her over to request some additional waters and a refill on my sons drink. We sat. We sat more. For 8 minutes to be exact watching her chit chat in the take out area with other servers and hang near a table of guests in the corner. No drinks. Finally my husband asked her a 2nd time and she brought them, 11 minutes waiting. Food time - 21 minutes in. Entrées arrive and we ask for a few side items (mayo & ranch), and drink refills. Karla leaves again and never returns. My 7 year old is sitting waiting to eat but needs mayo for her burger.  My husband finally went up to get it himself and spoke with the manager. In the meantime Karla strolls by and says "did you ask me for something, cause I forgot?".  As we waited for the manager to bring the items over, the appropriate seating conscientious hostess seats an obviously drunken party of swearing yelling men next to us. Mind you there are plenty of tables open on the other side of the restaurant where they would have been no bother to anyone. I immediately have these guys pounding the table, slamming into the back of me and yell-talking because they are in party mode. My Autistic son has sensory needs, and I had about enough fun for one day. I spoke briefly with the manager, let my son finish eating, and I took him to the car. Neither of us could handle any more. My husband and daughter stayed behind to finish eating, talking to the manager and pay the bill. I never ate. My husband pointed out to the manager a few simple things. One of which was the fact that we have both been in the service/hospitality industries, and neither of us could fathom why a rowdy group like that would have been sat in the quietest part of the restaurant when they could have been sat in the bar or away from families dining?  And second, when did Chili's lower their standards of staff and training? Probably the worst service In years, I am sure their corporate wont care but I will complain to them as well. Although the manager did discount the ticket, that means nothing. Service like this is what causes chains to die. Good luck to them.

Horrible! This is all I can say about this place. We go here quite frequently, and are almost always disappointed. Here's our experience from tonight: 1. We walk in around 8:30 pm. Place is mostly empty, but there is no one at the front to greet/seat you. Waited for 5+ minutes before someone showed up and took us to a table. 2. Floors were filthy as usual, but that's something we have come to accept at Chilis. They NEVER sweep their floors. 3. Appetizers arrived, but guess what. There was no silverware. And the plates were wet - really wet. Had to flag down the manager to get silverware and dry plates. Meanwhile, the appetizers were already cold. 4. While ordering, I had asked the server for extra plates (so our family could share the food), but there was no sign of any plates when the food came. Ask the guy who brought out the food (different person from our server) to get us some plates. 5 minutes later still no plates so I walked to the back to get some myself. Meanwhile the food is getting cold... 5. Need a refill on the water but our server hasn't shown herself since taking our order. So I tell the kids to just deal with it and wait until we get home. 6. Can't wait to get out of this place, so try to pull up the check on the little tablet/display they have on the tables. However, it was showing a completely different check (perhaps from the previous party at the table), so had to wait another 5+ minutes before I was able to flag down our server to get us our check. I am generally a good tipper, but this time I couldn't bring myself to leave a tip. Don't think we'll be going back, although I have said that before about this place. You have been warned!

This chilis has terrible service..... I came here for lunch with my friend and I was not impressed by the service. Our server took my order and then didn't even turn to my friend to ask her for hers!!! She just walked away...... Then I think she went on her lunch or break and didn't even let us know or introduce her coworker that was taking over. Her coworker that took over gave great service and went out of her way to make sure we got everything we needed. I wish I remembered her name. The food was good, just your average Chili's honestly but the restaurant needs to up their customer service immediately !!

Got there around 4 p.m. on a Tuesday. There are no vegetarian choices in tacos, tostadas or fajitas, so my son ordered the chicken tostada with no chicken, only beans (which was already included on the tostada) and no tomatoes. First order was wrong - it had chicken and tomatoes on it. The server, who was not our waitress, should have read the ticket to ensure she was delivering the correct order.  We got a replacement order, which was correct, but had a short black hair on the plate, and what I thought would be whole black beans was a barely noticeable, watery film of what I assume was bean paste spread on the bottom of the tostada with everything layered on top.  We returned that plate and didn't try for a third time. Fries were old, cold, dry, stale. Got a fresh batch and they were better but not very good. The potatoes didn't taste or feel fresh. I had the mushroom swiss burger, ordered it rare. It was delicious and juicy and the patty was large and one inch tall.   Regarding the ambiance, the windows were very dirty. Greasy kids fingerprints on the inside of most of the windows in the booths facing the parking lot, and the outside of the windows were smeared and dirty. They are not high windows, so it wouldn't be difficult to clean reach over and clean them. The table next to us was leaving when we were being seated, and was not cleaned the whole time we were there. The table next to that one was dirty when we got there and wasn't cleaned either. There were no dirty plates on these tables, but there were crumbs and food particles all over them, with silverware strewn about.  Arguing in the kitchen, and everything that was said in the kitchen was heard across the restaurant. Employees walking past seated customers complaining about their aches and pains to someone halfway across the restaurant, in the kitchen. There was just a sense of most of the employees not really caring about their work or how their behavior was affecting the customers. Although the male host was very nice and cheerful and seated us right away. Our waitress, Sylvia, was excellent, I don't think we'll return.

Terrible from the beginning. Waited 20 mins before we had to ask the hostess where our server was and then a server from a different section took care of us. Now, maybe I'm not clued in but when I ordered a chicken fajita I thought the chicken and veggies would be GRILLED!!! Not here. The chicken seemed like it was broiled or boiled and slapped onto the fajita grill right before serving. The veggies were limp and onions carmelized beyond recognition! Not coming back here! This is not how I remember Chilis! The restaurant was empty on a Friday night!!! Going downhill in my book!

Horrible service. We got seated quickly, however we then proceeded to sit at our table for 20 minutes before we were asked about drinks. While ordering drinks we ordered our food and waited 30 minutes for our food. We never saw any waiters or waitresses if we needed anything. The tables that were empty were covered with plates and cups. We will not be coming here again.
We love chili's food but the service and long wait for your food is awful at this location.  If love chili's, try the union city one.  We never had a problem there.

Rapid decline from last year -  Pros Our server was the only redeeming factor. She was new and had no one mentoring, though we could tell she would do great anywhere.  Cons Had to wait to be seated though restaurant appeared empty. Waited over 45 minutes for food to be served. Fly in the water. Fajitas were NOT what they used to serve. They appeared microwaved rather than grilled. Chicken and onions looked limp and bland. Beef Rib enchiladas served lukewarm - declined altogether.  Women's bathroom smelled like pee. Papers strewn on floor & soap dispenser lid broken off, resting on counter.  Asked for the Manager who was socializing in the bar. He said it was the hosts job to keep bathroom clean. She looked new and lost.  Manager took care of the bill though this did not save the experience. We left with a fussy baby, feeling stressed and vowing never to return. All for free food!
Look guys, its a Chilis, not some 5 star place. The foods great, the restaurant itself is clean and they have sports. Not much else is needed for a night out with some pals .

I have always liked chillys but now its even better u can order online. They have tablets at every table where u can order ur drinks rather than waiting for a waitress. If u kids they can play games on it. U get more detail of the menu. More food to puck from better deala it was great and fast service too. Now i know where i can go with my wife n son and not have to leave because of my son fussing. Just let him play games while he eats. I recomend it specially this chillys in particular awesome service and fast.

Happy Hour. . .perfect timing for the bar.  Lots of happy fun people.  Energy in bar area was great!!! Kerilyn (sorry if I misspell) was a very observant and good server.  Hope she is there when we go again.  Food was really really great. Cheers.

We hosted a Relay for Life Fundraiser evening here (actually 2!) and the service and food were awesome!  Both events were a success and the staff was extremely friend and accommodating, despite having a full house.   Food was good, drinks were strong and fun was had by all!  Evenings and events were a success!!  THANK YOU!!!

Menu has been "updated" lots of changes. Wish they had chicken fried steak , the fajita pita, and did they change their fries? =/ Restaurant itself was kind of dirty with trash on the floor. In all ok, not my first choice to come back.

Party of four went for an early Sunday dinner.  Service was fast and friendly.  Our water glasses were refilled periodically.  My aunt and uncle ordered the 2 for $20 which consisted of 2 entrees and 1 appetizer.  They got the guacamole appetizer.  It was generously sized that the four of us were able to share it.  My aunt got the bacon cheeseburger while my uncle got the 6oz sirloin.  Hubby ordered grilled shrimp tacos ($10.79) and a bottle of Stella ($5.29).  I ordered the chocolate molten cake ($6.59).  Our total bill minus tips was not even $50.  Food is what you'd normally find in a  typical American chain.  I wasn't impressed with the dessert though. However,  I'm still a fan because of the excellent value :)

Wow, I don't know what has happened to this Chili's! A group of 4 went there to attempt to have dinner last evening...around 5:30. There were a couple of small groups waiting but no problem. When the hostess told us it would be about 5 minutes, again, no problem. I also want to add that the entire left side of the restaurant was empty and there were 6 or 7 tables empty on the right side...but whatever. After about 20 minutes and watching several of the other groups give up and walk out we attempted to talk to one of the 2 employees that were standing around at the entrance, they said they didn't have enough servers, no other explanation, they didn't really care. Our group decided that if it took this long to get a table how long is it going to be to get our food...we decided to go to a restaurant that cared if they had customers. We were very surprised at what is going on at this Fremont location! Hopefully whoever is managing now wakes up and decides they want to stay in business. For now we will take our business elsewhere. That doesn't make any of us happy as this Chili's used to be a good and fun place to go.

Ummm, where are the utensils? I asked for a cup of coffee & they give me like warm coffee & no spoon to stir it with. They also gave me a steak knife with food still caked on the knife...Wow!!! Great customer service here!!
OMG their food was awful and salty beyond ingestion and over priced. Don't go here. The happy hour food sucks as well!

wow just called for pick up order told lady on phone my order after she asked what can i get you she says please hold so i can get somebody to help you really wtf. continued from yesterday well got my to go order get home and they screwed everything up not a happy yelper

Awful burger. Possibly the most disappointing burger I've ever had. The big Sierra Nevada is the only redeeming thing about this meal. Honestly I cannot believe this meal. I'm thinking about a run to in-n-out just to make up for this total mediocrity. I am shocked to be honest !!

I've been here a couple of times and always was annoyed of the manager always coming and interrupting us at our table about how they are now closed blah blah blah. I felt like she was basically trying to kick us out. I've worked in a restaurant before and my managers would NEVER go interrupt guests about us being closed. That is straight up rude to me, so basically don't go at night go during the day when the manager wont be rushing you to leave. Also my last visit was horrible. I ended up finding a fly in my drink & was extremely disgusted. That same manager apologized & took my drink & appetizer off my bill but still that is disgusting and thought she could have done more. SO AGAIN MAKE SURE TO GO DURING THE DAY & MAKE SURE TO ALWAYS CHECK YOUR DRINKS FOR FLIES
As their sign says on the entrance, they serve cancerous food. Their mexican food taste cancerous also.

I came to this Chili's with my children, my dad, and my brother. We were all very happy with our food, but not very impressed with the service. Our server wasn't terrible necessarily; but just didn't give off the impression that she enjoyed being around people. For example, we'd be asked if we needed something, but then I politely asked if she could bring a to-go box "whenever you get the chance" (said with a smile), and her responses always sounded like she was being inconvenienced. I'm still giving 4 stars because I think the food is consistent with other Chili's we've been to, and I liked the general ambiance of the restaurant.
It was okay. I went there with some friends for his bday. I ordered crispy chicken strips with corn on a cob and fries. The corn on the cob was like tasteless... The chicken was pretty good.

I have been to this location since it opened, so it has a lot of good memories for me. This makes me always want to give it another shot, but the last time I visited was pretty bad. My server was excellent, but the food arrived cold and very late. There was a table that was not cleaned that was next to us, which was actually pretty gross . There were not too many people in the restaurant , so I didn't know what the delay was for our food . The union city location is actually a lot better. I won't be back to the Fremont location, time to move on!

Typical American dishes. Food is good over all. Staff is attentive, especially the manager. My wife is allergic to tomatoes, and they took care to highlight the ingredients in various sauces and customized to our needs.

The food is great and the servers are excellent.  Their only problem is the lack of a couple of busboys which is why I gave it only three stars.  The servers have to clean off the tables and that cuts into the time they can spend with customers.  I ate there tonight and there was a large party that made a big mess.  They had three servers cleaning up the mess, which means that they spent less time doing their job which is waiting on the customers.  I've eaten in literally hundreds of restaurants all over the world, and these servers are the hardest working people that I've ever seen.

I am so disappointed! This place has unfortunately gone downhill! I use to love coming to this location for takeout or dine in! No matter where I moved (Newark or union city) I would travel to this location because I never had an issue with my order and the staff was amazing! It's been a year since I have dined/ takeout at this place and things have definitely changed and it's disappointing! The place needs a lot of tlc and new menus because they are becoming faded! Our order took a while to come out and when we did get our food it was not appealing at all. The staff is friendly but, the vibe is different! We spoke to our waitress and explained to her how we felt that things seem different and that the food has definitely changed! They mentioned that it is under new management and that they have been going through a rough time and things are kind of going downhill with staff. I don't know the whole situation with that is but, if the workers aren't happy then, something is not right! Hopefully this place gets better and back to how things were! I will definitely not be coming back here!

Yes I am giving this 4 stars; should be only 3 stars, however on this visit, the waitress kept on checking back with us. The food came out quickly, The seating was comfortable not cramped, the restaurant appeared to be clean.   With a friend, we ordered the two for 20 deal. The food: I ordered a steak dinner with broccoli n mashed potatoes.  The steak was great, however the, the broccoli was boiled not steamed and the mash was nothing to cheer about. Overall it was a good experience and I would come back if i happen to be there or friends were going.
Favorite restaurant in Fremont.  Love their Top Shelf Margaritas and fajitas. Happy Hour on a Friday night never disappoints.  The staff are friendly and efficient and always take good care of us.

Bar area is the best part of this restaurant - service has always been on the ball, food was fresh and made to order, and lots of tv's showing a good variety of sports.  Outside the bar area is a little hit and miss... Mostly due to servers.  We've had some good ones, some slow ones, some trying harder to be cute than competent... So it's kinda a gamble.  Recently remodeled - so the interior and exterior are in great shape.   Tip: I usually have better luck at lunch than dinner in regards to service.
Great spot for happy hour, Blue Pacific is strong, 1 will get the job done :)

I would've given 5 stars if not for the service here. The other night after we finished our meal we didn't leave for almost a 1/2 hour afterward. I had to get the attention of the hostess to ask for the bill. Finally when we received the bill it took long enough for the server to come pick it up and FINALLY make change. She was a nice you lady, just not moving. To top it all off, there was a couple sitting behind us that was seated after we were and left before we did. Aside from the service the food was great. A lot of variety to choose from at a fair price. Sports are showing on all TV's as well!!
Food was okay. Waiter was best but the much kitchen was the problem.  I guess to few cooks... late arrivals for food caused the service to decline.
Nothing too exciting here but the service is good and its reliable and you know what to expect from the food.

My husband and daughter went for dinner last night. The waiter took their order, brought the appetizers and completely forgot to bring the main course. My family waited 45 mins then realized that those around them are all getting served. The waiter admitted that he 'forgot' their order! This is not the first time that this place has poor service. Im wondering if the color of my family's skin has something to do with the poor service we receive from this place. By the way, we are dark skinned Asians.., I would not recommend this unfriendly place to anyone and I hope that Chillies takes moves out of the Hub!

Had lunch Friday with an old friend of mine at Chili's. I was taken aback by how filthy this place was starting with the outside needs painting the inside is very dingy windows were very dirty can hardly see outside. It was very disturbing when the person behind you moved on their bench you moved on yours. Need to address that problem I felt like I was on a boat trying to eat lunch.

Came here for late dinner, place was not pack, tv was on NBA game. Server came and took the order. Food was served within 15 minutes, would definitely come back again especially for the molten lava cake.

I went to this location for lunch on Friday it wasn't busy me and my boyfriend ordered the 2 for 20 with cheese fries as the appetizer. I only have an hour for lunch and we had about 45 minutes to eat. We must of been waiting for 25-30 minutes for any food to come out. I'm pretty frustrated that we can't even get the appetizer? I walk over to the kitchen area and what do I see? My fries sitting there. Why aren't they at my table? I'm already pissed because I knew I didn't even have time to eat. I tell them to give me boxes instead now that I'm out of time and literally within 2 minutes all my food comes out at once not even in the boxes but boxes on the side. Spent 25 dollars on food I didn't even get to enjoy til after work. don't go here if your short on time. They have no urge to get the food out or even let me know that they were sorry it was taking so long. Then some other guy thanks us for coming not even our waiter. No I did not enjoy my experience and won't be going back
This place gets pretty packed on Friday's. The great service here varies depending on the waitress/waiter you get. Tonight, it was a tad bit slow. Good thing the food quality was good.

Went here on 5/14/2014.  I visited the bar area around 3 o'clock and hung out  to watch the Giants basseball game.  The serves was great and the food was what I expected it to be.  Overall Thank you to the staff for the great job.  I will be back.

I have gone in here a couple of times.  I try to give this location another chance and its hard to when you get the same service.   The service isn't the greatest.  Unless you are one of 5 tables in the whole restaurant.  Try getting a refill or ask to complain about your food.....Um good luck!!  Also the manager on duty was telling the staff to go help tables.  Why couldn't he come over and help?   I tried a chicken salad there and the chicken was very dry.  The server took it away and I still had to pay for it!!  I had 3 bites.  Oh I was not happy!!!! I would only recommend this place for the drinks.  Even that is a little pricey!

Okay, im not one to really give under 4 stars, but as i was just at this restaurant, i felt that me & my friends were really disrespected by one of the waiters. I would have given them a complete 0, but the manager was nice enough to make up those points. Do you ever get that feeling that when the customer service is bad, it just ruins your appetite? Well that's what had happened to us tonight. I was very disappointed.

Every time I come here, I get pleasantly reminded as to why I keep coming back. Chili's is always busy, but everyone seems to be in a good mood! The food always comes out great, and I never feel rushed. Donna is who I ask for, if she isn't there I'll ask for Jenn! I like food, this place has good food, I like this place!

I used to go to chili's about every two weeks, and got great service,however this chili's has been slacking off. The last straw was Saturday, the restaurant was about 30 percent full and the staff did not seem busy.  We got a seat right away and then just sat there while server after server passed us by.  The hostess to her credit did try to get one of these servers to take our order but no one came after 10 minutes we walked out.

Standard reliable good eats and delish drinks. I was there for happy hour and had dinner there in the bar. I had the Cobb salad, which was gigantic and even though I ate until I was stuffed, I still had a half a plate of salad left. My friend and I also had the skinny patron margaritas! They are so good, and you really can't tell they aren't the real deal! The server was really great,very funny and handled everything in a really timely manner.

This is one of my fav. Chilis location. We always get really good and fast service here. Doesnt matter if its dinner or lunch.  The food is always served hot and fresh and the waiters are always around if you need them. I defin love this location.

I used to go to this Chili's all the time, when I lived in the area.... and they always had good service and decent food (for what it is)..... I went back last weekend, after a long day of shopping and was shocked to see how much the service has slid downhill. I don't know if the waitress we got is new, but she was AWFUL. She will go down in history as one of the worst waitresses I've ever had, anywhere. Here's a brief rundown: 1. Very slow to come take the order (during a not-super-busy time of day) and equally slow to check-in on us for the rest of the night. What would normally be a 45 minute meal took almost 2 hours, and only because she was painfully slow. 2. Our bottomless drinks were only refilled once, even though they were empty pretty much the entire time we were there -- and when she came to refill, she walked over with a pitcher of water and poured it into two glasses that were not formerly filled with water. WTF? 3. It took at least 30 mins after ordering for our APPETIZER to come out.... and when it came out, it was WRONG. At this point, we were starving and ate it anyway. By the time she realized her mistake, she acted like it was our fault and that she'd be doing this massive favor to us by not charging the extra $1 or whatever for the price difference. Um, no.. 4. When we finished eating, she came over with a bill and did not ask if we needed anything else or how things were. She was not into the customer service. 5. When we paid the bill, she rung it up completely wrong. She charged my card for 16 CENTS (aka her badge number or whatever) instead of the actual total, and obviously didn't even glance at the receipt before giving it to me to sign. I was nice enough to wait for her to come back (which took a good 10 minutes) and show her the mistake................ she went back to her manager to get the charge reversed and corrected and then charged me for the entire bill with ZERO discount or coupon or thank you for correcting the mistake. If I was like most people, I would have signed the receipt for 16 cents and walked out. I was shocked that they made no attempt to thank me for my honesty over HER mistake.  Totally lame service, and definitely the worst I've had at any Chili's... ever.

I ordered  a hamburger with bacon. The first time, the bacon was this side of raw. I carried the order back to the area where the waiters were and told them the problem. the manager(I guess, she never identified herself) offered to cook the bacon more, and then to make the bacon "extra crispy". The bacon came back just this side of burned. The waitress, who was very nice, accepted my cancellation of the order and the took a new order for some enchiladas. This was good, I ate half and waited for the waitress to come back , which didn't happen. I took the plate up to the take out counter, got a container,gave them 14.00 and left. Total time in Chili's, One hour!

The food was excellent. We ordered a club sandwich and the Caribbean Chicken Salad. HOWEVER it really bugs me that there are no drink prices on the menu (or anywhere else), not for alcoholic drinks and not for regular drinks!  My way of dealing with this is to simply not order a drink.  But in hindsight I think that is a mistake-- I think we should start demanding to know the prices and ask the servers why the prices are not posted or available in writing somewhere.   I don't think we should let this practice go unchallenged!

The server was very polite and energetic, which is always a bonus (and the reason they get 3 stars instead of less) but the Host would not stop giving my cousin dirty looks. Even if you recognize someone you dont like from high school or whatever you still need to be more professional at the workplace. Come on. The food however was good

I like the Caribbean Salad with shrimp, southwestern egg rolls, and the tortilla soup. I would like things better if it were less salty, and better quality meat. Some of the foods I don't like there. So, if I go I tend to get the ones that I like. The waiters are ok, they should try to make sure water or drinks are full and bring out food while it is fresh and hot. If you like dessert get the molten lava cake, cause that is very good if you like chocolate.

I don't know if it's me but I seem to be getting the better end of service and food lately. Came here with an old  friend to catch up on life. First off, this place was not so desolate inside the restaurant as I thought it would be. It was okay for a sunday afternoon. Extremely easy to find parking. This place is attached to a dying hub of stores ergo this explains the emptiness. Our waitress was attentive, and cool. She brought out the food a little too quickly. She even apologized for it arriving late to our table? I know this is the opposite of what most people complain about. Perhaps, we eat too slow. I don't know but that was some really quick service. We ordered the: -Texas Cheese Fries ---(These are highly recommended and very delicious.) The cheese was not as melty but more dried when it arrived to our table.  -Crispy Chicken Chipotle Crispers - Always a classic chicken tender to order. It doesn't have a wow factor but satisfies the hunger quite well. -Chicken Fajitas---A build your own Fajita meal. You're given 3 small soft flour tortillas, a plate of guacamole, salsa, sour cream and a sizzling plate of sliced chicken breast mounted on a grilled green chiles and sauteed onions. The Freshness :)  I wishthe fajitas were already assembled so I could have just eaten it . I also wish there was more soft flour tortilla pieces. But I guess it's okay since you have the option of customizable fajitas.  --Molten Lava Cake -- I've read too many yelp reviews and the people are not kidding. This cake is heaven. It has a warm moist chocolate cake texture with melted chocolate flowing out of its center. The cake is topped with vanilla ice cream covered by a chocolate shell. All the while being surrounded in a drizzle of caramel. lmfao! This is sounding more like cake porn.  However intensely sweet the cake may sound--it is not. We were able to eat the entire cake without being bothered the light sweetness. The cake is pretty huge btw. Our bill came to  $26 before tip. Great Cheap Eats!! I just had to give more than 15% tip because the food came out seriously fast.
Service was really poor today. Everything seemed fine until the 35th and 40th minute when food was still not delivered.

When you go to Chili's you cannot expect gourmet magic but rather American Bar/Grill food for 10-15 dollars per person.  When your expectations are set right, this chili's will not disappoint.  Some of their waiters are absolutely fantastic (others are only average).  The best things to order are the Pretzels with a side of caramel.  Trust me its fantastic! Of course the classic molten cake can also not be beaten.
Always good food and staff...the reason only four stars is due to a messy table...please sweep the floor..

Wasn't told the tablet on the table would  charge $1 to use and for 2 salsas and 1 basket of chips $8 come on you make way too much to charge for chips  and  salsa! I can get free wifi and complimentary  chips and salsaat another location.

Went there for lunch server Jordan super rude ridiculous was rolling her eyes is this how you give customer service really horrible we orders drinks got our drinks in like 15 min and waited for food for 30 min and on top of servers ridiculous attitude would never go back there

So we came in at approx 1 pm on Thursday June 12th and because they close one whole side because it is slow but today I saw people were leaving because of the long wait.  We were seated at 2:08 people
normally i usually get faster service but this time waiter took awhile and the food was ok. Great decor...

$6 lunch is pretty hard to beat (up to $8) even at Subway or Quiznos, a decent 1/2 sandwich, fries and soup will run you easily $10, plus this place has TVs to watch! I will definitely come here more often to try their happy hour menu, which is even better

Came here tonight for the blackberry patron margarita. Absolutely love it!! Our server was okay. He was nice, just not very personable. I felt a tad bit rushed by the end of our meal...I wanted another round before we left, but he had already brought the check. I asked for one more, then he brought an updated check...made a joke about it being my last one. Which was fine, but I just don't like feeling rushed. He was really nice & polite. I just wish he would have been a little more personable...& I wish that he would have made us feel a little more at home.

Chili's Togo service very good tonight.  Sometimes it's a hit or miss depending on who the person is working the Togo counter.   Have found using the online ordering to be more accurate and dependable and less wait time at the counter.  Online ordering gives you an approx. pick up time and if you add 5 minutes to that you are able to walk in and pick up your order with ease.   Can't go wrong with the food prep.  Chili's cooks are a cut above the rest.  Double check your order if prepackaged as the counter help has left items out of the order before, but not tonight kudos to the Togo server today!

I would've given them 0 if given the option! Took some guests over for drinks and dinner ...server was quite rude , impatient and overall generally irritated . Food was terrible and the server had an even worse attitude about it and seemingly didn't  beleive us, tasted the food and then went about telling us that it seemed fine to him!  Completely spoiled our mood..we just finished off our drinks ..called for the check, spoke to the mgr about the whole experience  Atleast the mgr was really nice and took care of the food bill  and we ended up paying for the drinks alone.

I usually come here for the soup and salad deal for lunch. For under $10 you can have unlimited soft drinks, salad, and soup. The chicken enchilada soup is a must have!     The service here is okay. Sometimes when it's busy, the server sometimes forgets to refill your drinks or even bother to ask you if you want anymore salad or soups.

Pros:  Cheap Convinient Location Cons:  The cost of the food and location weren't enough for me to ever go back.  Neither my boyfriend or I finished our food.  The homeless people squatting in the church right outside the window we were seated next to made for an interesting view.  That gross sour smell and taste that some diner chains have... this place had it.  Advice:  If you do go here for some reason, get something greasy, deep friend and covered with cheese. Don't try to go pseudo-healthy. You'll be deeply disappointed. My 1400 calorie side order of french fries covered in cheese and bacon was the only thing I could really get down. Which is ironic considering I'm a total health freak.
I LOVE Chilis! But I went here yesterday and was disappointed with our service. THe waiter didnt seem attentive at all...and they were not even busy.  Wish it wouldve gone better!

Maybe it is just bad timing, the men's bathroom is overflowing with trash on the floor, paper towel is out, and there is no trash can near the door to throw away the paper towel you use to open the door handle...

Took the brats in my life out to lunch last week while we were out and about. We were seated quickly and had a really nice waiter.  He came and checked up on us often and when I did not like my carribean salad he took it off the bill ( the drown it in the dressing ... if you order this ask for the dressing on the side) I enjoyed my lunch date and would probably go back to this chilis for a meal if Im in the area which is kinda rare for me. Ask for Daniel as your waiter hes a sweetie leave him a big tip he works for it!

Had one of their 'lunch specials'. Have to say they have the absolute most horrid french fries in the state of California.-maybe beyond. I spoke to  a few of my friends later and they said the same thing.  Never again.

Bad service. The manager Anita was extremely rude to me and my 10 coworkers. We went here for dinner as a meeting and she did not treat us well at all, we ended up leaving before the food even came and canceling our order. Would not recommend it.
closed for plumbing issues at 730...i got their at 715 fyi people you already have shitty service...now this!

I always end up here when I'm having trouble deciding what I want! haha. My co-workers and I have gathered here many nights after working the lunch shift drinking and eating appetizers for hours. Our bill has easily climbed to $200 bucks before. The margartitas are good and depending on which bartender is working are strong! :) I've never had a problem with the service here and have enjoyed myself many times! I just wished they had a better happy hour!  The food though has been hit or miss. The chips have been WAAY too salty, foods been cold before- but it has been fixed everytime. They have obviously been doing alot of upgrading and I have to say its paying off for them!  Ohh and they have the 2 for $20 deal going on right now, but they options they give you arent that good. You can get a better 2 for $20 deal that INCLUDES dessert.
Foods barely ok, it's really noisy now that they have switched to all tables and no booths, the physical menu is organized like a 4y olds underwear drawer! I will not be back anytime soon :(

They offer a coupon for kids eat free with a purchase of an adult entree. This is always a plus for families. The new decor is nice, sharp and modern. I hated the tile tables and weird crap all over the walls they used to have. Service was good, food is always just 'ehh just okay' but this is one of the places I can go with the kids.
If your looking for a place to grab a couple drinks and some apps to eat with the girls... this is a decent place to go... It's nothing outstanding... It's simply tried and true...
Need to work extra hard at making better food, no flavor, completely bland, but they do have icy cold beer.
Their "Old Timer "hamburgers are excellent. I love the mashed potatoes and gravy as a side. Service is always good. they have good lunch combo's and always I enjoy the email specials.

I'm not a huge fan of Chili's and I don't come here too often. I came here today because my boyfriend and his friends wanted to eat  somewhere cheap.  The restaurant wasn't too busy and the service was mediocre. Our whole table decided to get the Pairing Picks since it was 1 appetizer and 1 entree for $10 which wasn't bad, but there weren't many good selections to choose from. I ended up getting the Onion Strings for my appetizer and the Fried Shrimp entree. The Onion Strings were super greasy and I could feel my arteries clogging by the minute! The Fried Shrimp was actually PRETTY good! The breaded was crunchy and not like other fried shrimp I've tasted.  Our server was kind of slow and wasn't really on point. It's alright thought because I didn't really expect that much knowing that it's a chain restaurant.

Welcome to the 21st century Chili's!! The recent renovation is a great improvement. And of course the food, as always, is outstanding. When times are good and money is plentiful: the triple fajita platter is the one to beat. Chicken, steak, and shrimp with all the fixens. YUM! And when times are tight(like recently): the Bottomless Soup & Salad makes the Scotsman happy. Especially that recent Cajunny soup-yikes thats good soup! I never thought you could out-do the enchiada soup, but you did!  Very good Chili's. Great food, endless lemonade, and attentive, outstanding service makes this place a solid 4 Stars.
I have been going here for15 years. The food is always good and the service is too. It is what you would expect from Chili's.

This is not so much a complaint to this particular Chili's, but to the whole chain. They hate vegetarians. Seriously.  A lot of my friends like to go here and when I don't win I am forced to go as well. Choices for Vegetarians: -Black Bean Burger (actually pretty good, but I easily tire of it). - Ceasar Salad (nothing special)  - NO SOUPS! Even the brocolli and cheese has bacon in it! - Nachos without the meat- essentially melted cheese on a chip for $8. YUM. - Some salad without the meat...lame. Seriously, it is really bad. Never have I been to place where even all the soup has meat in it, and the nachos can't be made without meat.
I like how this place is well clean and not as crowded as other Chili's joint. I like how their staff is so friendly and very well into their work; so precised!

Went there tonight for dinner. Ordered chips for an appetizers. Found a piece of The chip heat sensor in our chips.  Was a dirty, oil covered metal thing that broke off the machine.  Almost ate it, but didn't ... but hey they comped my chips.  Jot the rest of the $32 meal. Ridiculous. Find a health hazard..... won't be back. Ever.

Hubby & I went out for a late-ish lunch.  We both ordered the lunch express soup, house salad, and chips w/ salsa that has unlimited refills.  Hubby paid .60 extra to have the chili.  Chips/salsa came out pretty soon.  Chips are tasty but the salsa taste like a salty bottled salsa.  Oh well.  Salads showed up and they were your typical salad.  My hubby finished his salad way before the soups ever showed up.  Why weren't they served at the same time?  My guess was that they want to fill you up on the cheap chips and salad.  My hubby was VERY disappointed in the chili.  He was under the weather and had read the menu wrong (poor guy), but he was expecting chili with chunks of beef and beans.  Well this chili had no beans and a tiny bit of hamburger.  It was more a Mexican tomato soup...not chili.  When our server FINALLY drug his butt over to our table, my hubby asked for more chili but maybe with some more beef and beans this time.  Well the chili never came but the manager eventually showed up with an apology (of sorts).  Well it appears that Chili's chili is from a third party and comes in a bag.  Yummm.  No wonder they charge extra for it.  Oh and it doesn't have beans in it.  Maybe I just am unreasonable but if the name of your restaurant is CHILI'S, perhaps your CHILI is something you would be proud to serve.  They've got one large set of cajones charging you extra for that "chili." BTW - don't let them sit you with a server named Dane.  We rarely saw Dane.  I think I was invisible.  When we arrived, the hubby left to wash up so I was sitting by myself.  Dane didn't bother to make an appearance until AFTER hubby returned.  Hubby was unhappy with his chili and needed a drink refill...no Dane to be found.  I wanted more soup...no Dane.  Even when Dane managed to show up, hubby got a drink refill but I didn't.  I had an empty bowl of soup and salad but I wasn't asked if I needed anything.  We were in a hurry to get the hell out of there, so the bill was paid quickly.  After coming home I decided that Chili's corporate needed to hear about our wonderful dining experience.  I started looking at the receipt for the info they ask for and low and behold, I find that Dane had charged us incorrectly.  The manager deducted the chili/salad lunch, which we didn't ask for.  However, we were charge an additional $3.79 for a side house salad.  Explain to me how, if the server didn't have his head in the clouds, you would charge somebody for a side house salad when all they ordered was 2 drinks, and 2 bottomless soup & SALAD lunches.   It has been quite a while since I had been to Chili's.  As I told Chili's corporate, it will be even longer before I return.  I also mentioned that I would write a scathing Yelp review.  I hope I was scathing enough.   What a joke!!!!!

On an über busy Friday night my boyfriend and I stopped here for dinner.  I only eat queso dip and have cocktails at Chili's.  There were clearly people waiting to be seated.  As we walked in, we were greeted by a guys who let us know that we could sit at the bar if we wanted.  We avoided the wait and sat in the bar area.  We got really good service while we were there.  Our server was super attentive despite the crowds. I'm a fan.

Went on Saturday, December 10th at approx 7pm...I wish I could remember our server's name BUT anywho .. she was GREAT!  When we first entered, my daughter greeted the hostess with a huge hug AND my daughter does not ever great strangers let alone people she knows this way.  Our server was fantastic, she introduced us to the remainder of the servers that would be assisting her.  THE FOOD!! OUTSTANDING!!!  She told us the cook was fantastic and she was right.  I plan on going back on the night she works which are Friday and Saturdays!!!

I mean...it's Chili's. Now, you can decide for yourself what that means but for me, it mean's it's just Chili's. It's not special, but it's by now means disgusting food. My friends and I had planned on coming here to get one of the deals "where you get a full-size appetizer, two full-size entrees and a full size dessert for $20.00 USD." (yelper Allan H.) But the deal was over, though we did try asking the waiter if they could make an exception, he said no. Which, I don't blame him. The deal's over - you can't.  The reason for it not getting 5 stars is because well... the food is good, not exceptional or anything. Or server was just annoying. But I think it was part of his "friendliness" and "charming personality." He was very sarcastic, and it was just "..." everytime he came to our table.  It's just Chili's... Oh and we always joke around that their Bottom-Less Chips, are NOT bottom-less. We can see the bottom, you gotta refil our chips before we see the bottom. C'mon! (just kidding)

I used to come here all the time when I was in high school...I actually started to hate it! But I went tonight after a few years, and on a Saturday night...is crowded as I thought. I'm assuming it's still popular in good ol' Lame Fremont :) They changed there menu and I like the triple dipper choice for 9.99. Even though it was busy, our waiter Eddie was really nice, professional, refilled our drinks, and easy-going...good job! I ordered one of the newer entrees...the Carne asada steak, which is under the guiltless grills? part of the menu (supposedly they're healthier). i never really order from that part haha. anyway, i was afraid it was going to come out dry, but it came out juicy and very tasty..and the pico de gallo was awesome! the steak was smaller than i thought but hey...its good to have a portion thats just right...not too big! and we ordered the paradise pie for dessert..it was good but NOT as good as before...tasted kinda dry, not moist like how i remember in high school. if you're looking for a good bite to eat..chili's isnt bad..its better than applebees (GROSS).  they need more seats for people waiting to be seated! =P

Haven't been here for awhile and heres the reason. For the price you pay at Chili's for a regular hamburger and fries you can walk right across the street to Elephant Bar and get something even better... like a nice half rack of lamb w/ mashed potatoes.  I'm not a fan of the service either. I think all the waiters and waitresses are current seniors at my old high school. Out of all the restaurants in Fremont I think that Chili's would be last on my list.

I'm no snob to chain restaurants...in fact, i go to them frequently.  This Chili's is, by far, one of the worst ones!! Service was slow, food was mediocre, and the ambience was bleh... My pasta was bland, the chicken on top was too salty...combined together, they didn't balance each other out!  The bf's steak was dry and slathered (not marinated) with what they called "cajun sauce."  Ughh!! Too bad Elephant Bar was too crowded...this is where we really wanted to go.

Been going here for years and years, and I love the food. The service has slipped a bit, as I think it has at most Chilis restaurants, but it's still not bad. Great place to get appetizers or just eat at the bar!

I hadn't been to a Chili's in over a year before yesterday.  There were some really interesting new additions to the menu, including what I ordered, the Southwest Cedar Plank Tilapia (I know tilapia is not a vegetable thanks).  ...but I'm soooo glad I betrayed my veggie-self because it was fantastic!!  I don't know if we just picked a good night, but the food and the service were both excellent. I also love that they have the black bean burger here, it's a nice change from the gardenburger or boca burger that you usually get.  ...and my favorite thing about Chili's...all their nutritional information is online!!  I LOVE it when restaurants do that. I'm ready for my public flogging for getting this excited about a chain restaurant.

I have to update on my prior review, as I've been back twice since I last reviewed.  Like I said, I have been back twice since my review, one time with my mom, another time out with my boyfriend.  My mom and me had a nice Indian server, who took really good care of us; although it seemed he was kind of annoyed with us to begin with. Our food was good, although I felt they were kind of stingey on the amount of fries, so I had to ask for more (which they gave me thankfully).  When my boyfriend and I had gone out to dinner there, one of our favorite servers, Dane, was working. He always takes really good care of us and is really friendly. The food was good, but they have cut back on how much they give you fries wise.  Because of those two experiences (although not the reduced fry amount) it deserved one more star.

Just had dinner hear.... Service was GARBAGE! Only reason why I'm even giving it 2 stars is because the food was decent, and our total bill came out to $21 because of the promotional menu they have right now. We waited 15 minutes for a table and saw a booth open up at the bar. The waitress came right away and took our drink orders, and 5 minutes later too our food order. She was really short and not very friendly or welcoming... (we over heard her saying one of her tables had just left with out paying their bill). Anyways, we waited for 35-45 minutes for our main dish to come out. Sometime inbetween that wait, a waiter/cook or some one came out and brought us some buffalo wings on the house. During this time, not once did our waitress come and ask if we needed anything or apologize for the long wait. We eventually got our food, had to ask for our dessert, had to ask for a box, and then she disappeared. Another waitress came by and gave us a check, but noticed we were charged for the wings... she came back 5 minutes later, said she'll talk to the manager. Waited another 5 minutes, drops off our check and we realize its some one elses check...wait another 5 minutes, tell her the problem once again, and then she gets our correct check.
