By the time we paid, we just were so fed up and wanted to get out of there. Won't be coming here anytime soon.

I go to this Chili's about once a week... We always go sit in the bar and order with no problems. Service is great when you dine-in. If you order to-go... Expect something to be wrong with your order. Every single time we have ordered to go... They either forget something, won't have it ready when you get there, or completely get you order wrong. They don't repeat the order back to you so you can correct them if they missed something, and this is the last time we will be going there. I will go to Applebee's or Jack's before I go here again.

I went during their Happy Hours (3 to 7pm)..Fisrt thing you need to know is its only in the Bar..so u will have to wait for the tables to get empty if you are coming with a large group for a game and drinks..by the way its just a dollar off on drinks, i would suggest going to Hooters (50% off) which is like half a mile away on Mowry Ave...but if you are in for eating, Chilis have better tasting food to offer (Margarita Chicken, Chicken Pasta).. Their service is very slow, the drinks arrived after 12-15 mins, thts a sham for Happy Hour service...
Horrible service, the waiter was slow, the food took forever to come. DONT GO

Service is generally good here, sometimes it will take a while to get food out but for the most part the service is very friendly. If you're going out to celebrate try the presidente margaritas, strawberry is pretty good for a flavored drink.

Just depends on the day your there and your waiter. Sometimes your waiter is attentive your orders is right and yoru food os warn. Mut just depends on your luck that day. Quite a few times I have been there, my waiter gets my order brings my food and disapears. SO good luck  if you need a refill or napkins. Last time I was there I was seated and told there are no high shairs, I had my one year old in my lap until half way through dinner when I found an empty one myself.

Went here for the first time with friends last night for dinner for no special occassion. Our server was quite attentive and funny, so definitely thumbs up for service. Food was a little on the salty side. I ordered the Chili's Sirloin and couldn't finish it because it got too salty. All the food was a little on the salty side. If you like salty food, then definitely come here. I wouldn't mind coming back and try something else, but I wouldn't go out of my way to go here. The only other reason we went here was because I had a gift card. ZING! Why put a good gift card to waste?

It is not dainty or cute, or sophisticated - and probably not a "date" meal, but I don't care.. I love the 3 courses for 2, $20 deal! The portions are actually full sized. I thought it was going to be smaller for this deal. I like the queso chip thing. YUM!

I've been going to this Chili's location for years.  We used to go to Happy Hour there any where from 1-3 times a week.  The food is delicious and the service has been great.   I think I only had one time where service was bad, in all the years I've been there.  And the only food that I didn't care for was the Fetuccine Alfredo.  I didnt' care for the sauce.   This location is great......the Union City one, at Union Landing, I don't care for.  I couldn't find them on here, so wasnt' able to rate them.  But I just went recently, and the chicken tortilla soup (which is a favorite of mine and my friends) was extra, extra salty on top of being cold.  This was not the first time that's happened when getting soup there.  And then I ordered Chicken tacos...and again, the whole dish was cold, from the tacos to the rice and beans. So, if you want to eat at Chili's and you're trying to decide between Fremont or Union CIty, I'd go to the Fremont Location.

I went there this weekend with my boyfriend on a Saturday night.  He had a craving for fajitas so Chili's was the place to go.  We got there at 8PM, and no wait on a Saturday night.  We were seated quickly, but we waited at least 10 mins before the server came over.  I had to flag down the hostess and ASK if we had a server or not.  I am a server and have been for some time. I can understand waiting a few minutes, but really!? The manager was made aware that we had been waiting and sent someone who was off the clock to take our order.  I appreciated that.  However, our waitress came out, dropped our drinks, brought our food AND THE CHECK at the same time! WTF!!   She wanted to get rid of us already! No other tables from other servers had their check on the table with their food.  So WTF!  There was no wait and now I know why.  I was also pissed that the manager didn't come over and apologize for our wait after he was aware of the situation.  I watched our waitress, the manager, AND other staff talk near the kitchen (right in front of us) when things needed to get done (we needed drink refills) but she couldn't be torn away from the very interesting conversation that she was a part of.   Chili's has gone down hill.  I don't require much.  I want to be greeted before I have sat for 5 minutes (even a "hey i'll be right with you" is good enough) and just  a check back a few times, and then the check after my plates are cleared.  This place was a disgrace and we have given up on Chili's altogether and you should too!

Took the office to lunch today. We got there at around 12:05 and was seated right away. That's when things got bad. We waited for 10 minutes and no server. We flagged down the host and was told that someone will be with us soon. We waited another 5 minutes and still no service.  We ended up walking out and went to a nearby restaurant.  One of my colleague mentioned her disappointment to the manager who said he would personally serve us if we stay.  Not!

Great location. I've always been fond of this location. Servers tend to stay there forever. Last two visits were a NIGHTMARE!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I can't stress NIGHTMARE enough!!! Our server was CHELSEA. If you go to this location and your server is CHELSEA I highly recommend running for the hills as fast as you can! I took my son there for his 2nd Birthday with a good sized group of friends and family. We are the easiest people on earth to please. The alcoholic drinks some people at my table had ordered came after we already paid our bill. They were mudslides and brought to us by another worker. He informed us they had been sitting at the bar for a long long time. Which was clear because they were melted. When I ordered a dessert and told CHELSEA once again it was my 2 year old son's Birthday, she came back with the dessert and set it on the table, said we don't do anything at all for birthdays because Chili's is owned by a religion who doesn't celebrate holidays and birthdays! I was in complete shock. She was my server the following time and was just as bad. She was serving a table next to us they were so disgusted and upset they ended up walking out before they even got their food. After this experience and the last I wanted to never go out to eat again. I lost hope in the service industry because of the server we had.

Worst Margarita in my life!!!  Definately too much ice, it tastes like mildly tequila flavored water/slushy.  They got an extra star for decent service.  Meaning the wait staff, not the bar obviously.

food portions and quality has gone down hill!  last few times there we have had waiters that could give a damn about their tables. Ordered a cheeseburger... it was inedible! Soup I ordered had sat under a heat lamp and had a nasty scab over the top of it. i could go on, just trust me when i tell you it was terrible

I would say I am a fan now only because they've recently began a new deal, where you get a full-size appetizer, two full-size entrees and a full size dessert for $20.00 USD. That is right ladies and gentlemen, all that for $20. We ordered the Texas Cheese Fries for starters and I got the Big Mouth Bites and my girlfriend got the Jalapeno Steak Quesadilla. We got the Molten Chocolate cake for dessert, which is as good as it sounds. The only things keeping me from coming back to this place is really the shitty service and the fact that I would only come here for the 3 for 20 deal, which is pretty damn good.

We have been many Chili's restaurants, but this location is in need of better customer service, improvements on food and cleaniness!  We ordered the 2 for $20 deal and usually this is a good deal for the price, but the quality of the food that we received was not good.   First, we got seated next to a wall by the entry and being that it was already freezing outside we got to feel the coldness coming in through the outside windows.  They had the cold air running from their vents up so high that our heads were being blasted by the coldness from the start. When we asked if we could move our seats to a warmer location (table next door) our waitress said, there was no tables available.  That's because they were slow on cleaning up the 2 empty dirty tables. Our waitress, said they asked their manager to turn down the air, but it never happened.  Everyone, around us was bundled up wearing their jackets.  If we had gloves, we would have worn those to try and eat!   Finally, we were moved.   Next, came the appetizers. The guacamole was actually good, chunks of avocado with a good portion, however the chips were greasy and were basically broken small pieces.  We finally asked another server for a better basket of chips, which she complied  and brought with a smile...kuddos to this 2nd waitress. Our 2nd appetizer was tossed on our table by some other waiter who said, nothing after roughly throwing down the onion strings/fried jalapenos.   Don't order a cheeseburger or any hamburger at this location until they learn how to cook one correctly.  Usually, a burger from a Chili's restaurant is pretty decent and juicy.  I asked for medium rare, it came out well done and dry.  I did not ask them to redo it as I didn't want to get my next burger back with more attitude and a long wait time.  Our other diners had the quesadilla explosion salad, it was "ok" fair amount, but on the soggy side.  Cleaniness is in order for improvements on this restaurant.  There were used napkins, straws on the ground around our seating as well as surrounding areas on the way to the restrooms.  Management, is lacking here and needs great improvement for a Chili's environment.  Overall, if you want a good Chili's restaurant...try the location in Pleasanton, off of Hopyard it has never disappointed us! This place is getting one star only because of the guacamole!

We came here a few weeks ago on our way home, and I had seen a commercial for the 2 for $20 on tv and wanted to try something different because we were becoming very dissapointed w/ Applesbee's. I ordered the chicken tacos, my boyfriend got the bacon cheeseburger, both were delicious. The queso dip was also delicous and they gave us so many chips. Normally, some restaraunts are chimsy w/ the chips. The chocolate lave cake was yummy two, nice size, it took four of us to finish it off. I was really impressed with our waiter, he was so quick and very on it, we didn't even have to ask for refills. So I gave him a good tip because he deserved it. If I am ever in the area again, we are coming back!

Went yesterday for dinner.  Haven't been there in a while.  Looks like they added more stuff to their menu.  Husband had the baby back ribs, the dry Memphis run ones and the Kentucky borbon ones.  They were really good.  I had the Mesquite Chickin Salad which was really good as well.  If you are looking for an easy going place to have dinner, this is the place!  Our server was great as well.

This is the only chain restaurant I can honestly say I really like. I view Chili's as a "default" place for a quick lunch with friends. Don't ever take business clients here. The burgers here are amazing, the service is always by the book and the drinks are never watered down. Only complaint? Menu's are greasy and unclean. ugh

I've gone to this Chili's a few times in the past month because of the 2 for $20 deal. Even though my friends and I went on a Saturday night and came with a larger group (6-8 people), we were seated quickly and had attentive servers. The 2 for $20 deal is great, since everything is full size. The appetizers are good portions; if you order skillet queso or chips and salsa, the chips are bottomless! You have a wide variety of selections for each course, so I've been able to try lots of new things I probably wouldn't order at full price. I totally blow my diet every time I go, but it's worth it!

Oh my! This place is really lousy and has gone downhill drastically over the last couple of years. We used to go there regularly...like twice a week sometimes. We don't go there anymore...here are the reasons why (I'm only listing problems we experienced multiple times):  1. Server doesn't come over to great us until we have been sitting in our booth for 5-10 minutes. 2. Servers and managers tend to sit in a corner booth and chat with each other while we and/or other patrons are waiting for drink refills, napkins, or food. 3. Food order has been screwed up or cooked wrong  (If I wanted raw fish, I would have hit a sushi bar) 4. Managers seem very disinterested in fixing any problems. 5. We have heard staff using cuss words in the kitchen area. 6. Two times...when I was picking up food to go, I saw a waiter pick up a french fry off of a plate and eat it, then take the plate out to a customer. 7. When the wait staff serves us, they seem like they would rather be with their coworkers chatting then earning their tip. That's it in a nutshell. Its really sad considering the low number of restaurants like these that are in Fremont. Now a days, you have to go to Union City or other places for this type of food. I've complained to their corporate office but no one does anything. They just don't seem to really care at this place. I've been to other Chili's (Monterey CA,  Houston Texas, Milipitas CA) and they are all so much better. The staff has a great attitude and the food is good. Why can't the Fremont grill step up to the plate???? Hey Corporate...PAY ATTENTION...FIX THE PROBLEM!!!
2 words: CHICKEN CRISPERS. dooooo it. its pretty much the ONLY thing ive ever ordered. and, NO, i am not a 10yr old child. im a grown woman who LOVES chili's chicken crispers.

Not a huge fan of typical American restaurants, but it's better than some places I've been to.  The surf and turf (steak and shrimp) was great!  The portions were generous and definitely filling.  I loved the mashed potatoes here though.  Wish I tried the desserts.  Service was awfully slow for a place that wasn't too crowded during lunch hours.

I've been hitting up this Chili's a lot lately. I'm not sure why but I've been craving it.  I love their chicken tacos and their fries and sometimes I even crave some real meat and so I've been trying their rib selection. You know I must say it's not bad. I've been very happy with the service and the food. Fast food.. it doesn't take long for them to serve you and get you in and out in no time. Hooray I'm a new fan!
these waiters are extremely slow and don't offer very good service. food takes way too long and drinks take even longer! choose somewhere else please.

We went yesterday, I got the new Triple the Cheese Big Mouth Burger. Yes it was big, but wasnt as good as the Smokehouse Bbq Burger. I think that is the best out of the 3. I recommend it and you will be stuffed after eating it. My son got the adult sized chicken fingers. I was expecting it to be breaded and fried, ya know how you get them everywhere. So they come out looking like fried fish nuggets. They were over breaded and kinda nasty. He wouldnt eat them and I didnt blame him. I took off the breading (Which it was soggy and greasy) and they were sorta slimy, yet fully cooked. Plus they put pepper on the corn on the cob and the fries - the waiter could have told me about the pepper, I dont know any kid that likes pepper.  Ive been going to this Chilis since I was a teenager and yes it has changed, the menu and the look of the place (seems like they took down all their flare that they used to have covering the walls, like Applebees) Still LOVE their chips and salsa. Sometimes I just order the chips and salsa to go!

Food is pretty good here.  I ordered the Quesadilla Explosion, (which is a salad).  It was really filling for a salad.  The servers are friendly and the service is fairly prompt.  I would come back here in the future.
Haven't been to Chili's in a while.  The place was packed on a late Thursday night. Their new new menu is worth coming back soon. The Buffalo Chicken Fajitas were original and delicious.

So, I've been in the "Tri-City" area for a good 5 years now. Chili's has been a frequent dinner stop for my friends and I. I've never been super impressed with what you get there, but I have to say that over the 5 years I've been there it's gone down, down, down hill!  My last visit, two nights ago, led me to yelp. We sat down after a short wait for the table (nice). Waited a good 10 minutes until someone came to order our drinks. We finally put our order in after a good 20 minutes of sitting at our table.  The queso dip came....cold. 15 min later our dinner salads came. A bowl of mushy diced tomatoes and carotts...little lettuce.  The best part was the 45 minutes of waiting for our meals! There weren't many tables occupied but what was there were a couple large parties. LOUD! Always loud there!  Food came and we took one look at our plates and couldn't get a bite down. We sat so long waiting that we (two people) ate the whole queso appetizer! I was able to squeeze down one small fajita and called it quits. Then called over the manager. Her response was I'm so sorry...if you are waiting too long for food you can always feel free to stop someone walking by and ask about it. My friend chimed in...who has been walking by to ask? Really, there were 20 min periods with no waiter walking around on the floor. She comped our dinner plates and left us to pay for drinks, salads, and queso dip. Lame! Honestly it'll be a long while before I'm there again....and it seems when I do go back to places they're gone! Sizzler, Black Angus...what's next? I miss my Sizzler :-(

alright so i went here yesterday with my gf we come here often. i always get the southwestern cobb salad with no pico de gallo. this dish is awsome i could never complain about this salad its hug come with avocado ranch dressing! delish! my gf got a typical chicken sandwich, she enjoyed that very well! the waitress we had was great! he always had our drinks on time and was sharp! when he went on brake he intraduced us to his back up waitress, she was awsome to! i i looove chilis! there very welcomed, except the asian host she is rude! did not even say hi to us, but the gay guy hostess whas great!! but it is cold in there hd to get my jacket on.
Went on Monday night for a B-day celebration, the food was nasty, the waiter keeps forgetting things,overall the chips and salsa was the only thing decent.

There's really not much point reviewing a Chili's but since I am still new to Yelp, I figure I get some practice writing more reviews. It is basically a typical Chili's restaurant...nothing less, nothing more. Although for some reason I felt my food tasted better than usual, maybe it was just because I was hungry from the 20 minute wait I had to endure. My only advice is to come on a Monday night or Sunday night so at least you can watch some quality football, instead of the Warriors and the Grizzlies turn the ball over...bleh.

DO NOT GO TO THIS CHILI'S!  THEY ARE THIEVES!!!!!  If I could put no stars thats what I would rate this Chilis in Fremont.  I left my ATM debit card at this Chilis and relized this later on in the evening.  I called them and spoke to the manager and he said he had my card.  I thought everything was okay and went to pick up my card that same day.....to my suprise someone there stole my numbers on my card and was using my card to make online purchases the next day and the following days.  The fraud dept. at my bank called me and made me aware of these purchases which started after i left my ATM at this Chilis.  When i called the manager to complain he said I "might"  have talked to you but quickly remembered me when i told him i was going to make a police report and will file charges when they find the person.  He wasn't that concerned of my complaints....Do not go to this chili's unless you want your Credit Card or ATM card numbers stolen!!!

i came here with some friends got some ribs and an appetizer. the dude disappeared and never came back with our appetizer until our food was ready. this tip already went down the drain then he tried to make it up with free drinks and extra chips. i guess it got him 1 dollar. but other then that i come here when i am in the area and im craving for a little bit of ribs. its good and thats all.

so went their today with my boyfriend. the staff is terribly rude. i wish i could remember my waiters name, he was really rude, while taking out drink orders, i asked what kind of drinks do they have, i didn't know he was going to be so mad he rolled his eyes and said coke, diet coke stuff like that i asked for lemonade and he walked away, didn't even ask my boyfriend so i said excuse me, he would like a coke thank you.. then he comes back to take our order i was sitting on my side of the booth with my purse and my boyfriend on the other side, the rude waiter comes to take my order, sits down ON TOP OF MY PURSE says sorry and jumps up, rudely. i ordered the mini tacos with rice and beans any my boyfriend ordered the old timer burger, we specifically asked for NO onions, there were onions on the burger and he even brought a cup of onions!! we both hate onions it was discus ting! ill never be returning to Chilis on Fremont blvd. thanks for nothing..

My co worker and I went for lunch at Chilis on Fremont Blvd last week and the service we recieved was a total disappointment. Here's how it all started. We walk through the door and there was no host at the desk. There were a bunch of guys in Chilis uniform sitting in the bar area chatting. After a lilttle while, one of the guys gets up, says hi to us, took us to our table and throws the menu on the table. We ignored his behaviour and requested if we could get a table near the window. He gave us a mean look, picks up the menu and just hands it to us and said go find a seat for yourselves and someone should be able to help you. Anyways, so we do find a seat for ourselves and then a girl comes in to take our orders. She asked us if we would like to start off with something to drink and we both ordered sodas. The sodas came in fast but the way it came in was inappropriate. The girl puts our soda on the table roughly while talking to another waitress and just walks off!!! After about 30 minutes, she comes back and takes our orders.The food came out pretty fast and it was actually good, hence the 1 star. So we are eating and then we are not even half way done eating, when the waitress got us the check and left it at the table without even asking us whether we needed something else and left. We waited another half an hour before we paid for the food and left so disappointed with the service and the attitudes of the staff. This was a wednesday and there were barely 12 people in the restaurant. I would have understood the stress if there were like a million people to serve at once. I have also filled in a customer survey online as indicated on the reciept and am yet to get a feedback. This is the first and the last time i'll ever set foot into Chilis!!

Great 2 for $20 deals and love the all you can eat soup, salad, and chips and salsa at lunch. Not the best desserts or service. Usually the Fremont location doesn't have a wait. Overall it's a good, casual place to go.

Why 5 stars? Let me elaborate. #1: Juliana is amazing. You need her as your server, she makes the freaking night! #2: Crispy shrimp mini tacos are the best! They are featured in a 2 for $20 deal! #3 Chili's just upgraded. The last six months, all their burgers went from "pre-frozen" to hand molded and cooked to order. Yeah. FAB! #4 One margarita had me swooning today #5: This GM is obviously doing a whole shitload better than the one beforehand. KUDOS MANG! #6 Brought a buddy of mine to this Chili's for the first time and he tried the Old Timer burger with cheese. Now he, and I quote, "loves Chili's!" #7 Did I mention Juliana? Woman is amazingly sweet, attentive, and hilarious! I'm glad she was our server, I'll be sure to ask for her from now on. But seriously, it takes a lot for me to give a fast food chain 5 stars, especially one like Chili's. Food was seriously off the hook, I finished everything (except the red beans, gas es no bueno)! Service was impeccable. Friend liked the joint so now I look good too HAHA. All I gotta say is, Chili's Fremont, you're doing something right! Great job people :)

I've never written a Yelp review but felt obligated to after my experience tonight. Before I start I will say THE FOOD HERE IS GREAT but that's about it.  So, I walk in the door with my party of 4 and the hostess and another male employee have their backs completely turned to us with their eyes glued to the Warriors game. I finally asked my brother to get the girl's attention so we could get a table... uhh HELLO????! Good thing she was nice. Anyway, we got to our table and waited. Waited, waited, waited. Our server finally came and took our drink orders and we didn't see him for another 15 minutes. At this point I just wanted to order my desert and get out of there (I'm 9 months pregnant, I NEED my brownie sundae). After we ordered, our server THEN decides to awkwardly let us know they're out of ice cream. IS THIS REAL LIFE?? That's all I came here for! We ordered a couple appetizers then got out of there. No "thank you" or "have a good night".  I know I probably sound like some picky bitch but I work in a restaurant and know if I pulled any of this crap off at my job I wouldn't have my job anymore. I don't fully blame these people for doing a shitty job, it all starts and ends with management. I really hope it changes soon... I really do love their food! Their service just sucks

Cool!  My first review.  (I can't actually believe I'm "yelp"ing.) But I decided to yelp about (one of) my favorite places to eat around the Fremont area.  I like Chili's a lot.  Their service is nice, the place is clean and cozy but spacious.  The waiters are usually really nice and attentive to customers' needs.  I personally am not a fan of chocolate, but I know that their molten cake is very infamous around the area.  TRY IT if you like chocolate. Now, down to the food.  I consider myself a salad fan, but Chili's ceasar salad with lime-grilled shrimp has got to be the best salad I have ever eaten.  REALLY.  It is worth it to add the couple bucks for the shrimp.  Other than that, I also really like their steak (so yummy).  I always order their classic sirloin with loaded mashed potatoes (the pepper-gravy one is delish too) and corn on the cob (not listed as a side on the menu, but you can order it).  It comes with garlic bread too.  Yum!  So filling.  I can never finish the whole thing!  Other things on the menu that I recommend is the spinach and artichoke dip and the skillet queso. As for service, I have never really had a problem.  They're really nice about splitting up the check, say if you're eating with a bunch of friends and each person wants to pay their own share a different way, etc.  I have never had to wait a long time to be seated, and I've been here a LOT of times. Give this place a try.  Even if you don't like it as much as I love it, I'm sure that it'll be at least satisfactory, and well-priced for the amount and quality of food & service you get. :)

Tonight I had the absolute worst experience I've ever had at any of  the chilis restaurant. Our server, Kiely refused to check up on us to see if we needed anything and our food took longer than usual to get made. When my fiance and i were full, we asked for the check. He gives Kiely a $50 bill while asking if she had change for a 50 or if would have to pay in smaller bills. our total was $29.22. She comes and gives my fiance some money back. We assume it is our change so we take our to-go boxes and head out. A man comes our yelling at us saying " hey are you gonna pay for your food?" Along with him are 2 other employees. Confused, I tell him we just paid and for him to ask Kiely. Kiely comes out and says she gave us change for 50. Im thinking " why would you give us change if we were ready to pay?" They made some bs excuse about the misunderstanding and didn't give us our change when we repaid. Considering the fact that we are black, I don't know if there was some type of stereotypical thing, they assumed we were trying to eat and leave which we've never done. My fiance makes 21/hour and I make 14/hour, im pretty sure we can afford a 2 for 20 without even putting a dent in our wallet. They could have came at us with a better approach and I will be calling their area manager
Good food, always open seating, staff is attentive.  Love this place, we go a lot.

Came here for a birthday lunch with my coworkers ... To my surprise it wasn't packed at all. So we were able to get seated right away =)  Our waitress was very pleasant and down to earth. Gave us some great suggestions because some of us were undecided. Explained their specials and got our drinks for us.  The service was very fast ... out came the appetizers and soon after wards came our meal!  FYI ... they don't sing on birthdays anymore =( but they do serve I think a chocolate lava cake =)

We went on a sunday afternoon after church, to celebrate a baptism.Party of 5 . 2 Persons ordered the chicken strips,2 people ordered hamburgers,and 1 person ordered a club sandwich.We  all ordered a bowl of tortilla soup. The chicken was dry and overcooked like it had been fried twice or more. The hamburgers were worse,we had both ordered them medium done and they were so crispy and well done they became tough and dry.The worst meal ever! They were slow with a mere handfull of people inside! Never go back,dont recommend. We werent told about  the 2 for $20. The server was a guy and dont care to remember his name !We spent over $80 !! :(
3 stars for okay food minus 4 stars for horrible service equals 2 stars. Right? Lol! I don't think it's just this location I think it's just how chili's operates.
Just your average American restaurant, I am not sure what the hype is about. The service was courteous, but the food was average American fare.
This chilli's is pretty good, much better than the one in Union city, Clean and Service is excellent. Have ordered a few times to go and Very good as well.

Service was pretty good and the food was OK. Nothing to write home about but it was decent. The thing that I did not like was the little tablet thing on the table. You use it to pay your bill, etc. and for that it is pretty handy. While I was talking to my wife, I looked over and it had a trivia question on it and it said "Play a game?" or something like that. So I answered the question and the nine that followed. Hey, I won the trivia game. Cool. It was too much to expect that I'd get a free soda or anything like that, but I confess I was pretty surprised to see a charge for $0.99 for table entertainment on my bill. I can tell you, I never saw anything saying I'd get charged but i was. My waitress did the eye-roll and the whole deal but I never knew I'd get charged. She basically called me a liar. Let me be clear: $0.99 is not going to break me. It is the principal of the thing. Let me push a button saying I agree to a charge of any kind for "table entertainment" or anything else. It is a rip-off and it colored my opinion of my experience there. So I charged the waitress $0.99 for small talk (deducting it from her tip). Am I going to Chili's Fremont again? Not if I can help it, no I'm not.And that tablet? I just might spill my soda on it, who knows?.

A big THANK YOU to the staff at the Fremont Chili's, especially our server, Megan!!!  We held our fundraiser there last night to help FirstSteps for Kids Inc. raise money for Walk Now for Autism Speaks. Everything went great. If you want a warm welcome, phenomenal service and awesome food and drinks this is the place for you! I'll definitely be back soon :)

Where else could I take my 9 year old son that would be fast, consistent, and satisfy his need for good fried food and burgers or mac and cheese.  This would not be my first choice of a restaurant, however, my son was happy, the service was excellent and the food was good.  I got a chicken sandwich that was full of flavor and the value of the kids meal was excellent.  I would go back with  the family, not for a date with my wife ;-)

I haven't been to this particular Chili's for a long time.  The last time I came here was when I used to live in Fremont.  Anyways, I came here with my friends to eat lunch.  The server took awhile to come to us because there were so many people who were finishing their meal at the same time.  It's okay though. We were all hungry and I ordered the Cajun Ribeye (medium-well) with two side orders of mashed potatoes with black pepper gravy and homestyle fries.  I was so hungry that I finished before my friend, who ordered the Flame-grilled Ribeye.  Good stuff!!!  Anyways, he was bragging about how fast he could eat but I guess it wasn't fast enough - at least eating the steak.  I might have beat him on finishing the steak but he just sped up and finished everything before I did.  Crazy! I'd say this was the right amount of food because it satisfied my hungry appetite.  I'll come here again in the future when I'm in Fremont again.

We have been going to this location for 20 years. With so many restaurants going out of business in Fremont, they have to be doing something right.  I love their food.  It is always perfectly served, fresh and tasty.  They ask what brand of rum you would like and ask what kind of ice you want in your margarita. The service has been fine.  For those getting bad service, maybe you did something to deserve it.

Once again Chilis Disapoints with lousy service and so-so food .... I can live with good food/ lousy service but both ? Nooooo ! My daughter is brainwashed that her B-day is an annual Chilis event , so I'm counting the days till her next B-day and unfortunately my next Chilis visit (wish she was born on a leap year ) . Guess that one star is for the lava cake . My prediction - Chilis will go the path of TGI Fridays - extinction !

I came here on Halloween to eat with my family.  I have to say the last time that I've been here was 12 years ago when I was probably 18 years old.  I remember things being better at this particular chili's.  I ordered a chicken and salad and chili, and i have to say it is not good.  However, I gave it 2 stars because my waitress was very nice.  Parking is also not bad.  And the staff is also very helpful.

2.5 stars, this review isn't just about Chili's specifically which is also probably a 3 star review, but about this particular Fremont location. Went on a somewhat gloomy Saturday with our friends and their baby. The place was pretty empty. The hostess was odd in that she addressed our party before two women who clearly had been there prior to us. I felt bad for them, but  it wasn't really our problem. Normally, I hate that attitude, but in this case, we wanted it to be low key with the baby so went ahead and took a table. Why did they seat us right between two other tables? Why not put us on an end table where we could disturb less people? The baby was very good, but she made gurgling noises and throaty notes of approval. Still the patrons next to us looked as though they were seated next to aliens. Sorry, but I don't consider Chili's at noon on a Saturday any kind of 'fine dining.' If this doesn't count as suitable for children, I'm not sure what else would. To compound this slight awkwardness, the server seemed slightly put off that our full attention was not on her and was instead on chatting amongst ourselves and catering to baby. I felt like she could have acknowledged our situation and proceeded accordingly. Instead, I caught her looking annoyed that we weren't attentive to her, "do you have room for dessert?" questions immediately. In short, Chili's did not seem very friendly nor did it seem terribly easy or good with children. (By the way, not being the proud parent of any children, I am new to this and curious-- who invented these 'sling' things? They seem terribly unstable to put a carrier on and just a bad idea in general.)

Good food, good service. Watching games in the bar area is pretty fun.  I don't think I've ever had a problem with customer service here, last time I was there (a few nights ago for the Giants game) they were great and very hospitable.
